Position Overview:The People Data Analyst works as part of the Employee Experience team to provide accurate, reliable, and accessible people-related metrics and insights. Using a variety of tools and working with stakeholders across the organization, the People Data Analyst analyses current and historical data for trends and patterns; to produce outputs designed to simplify complexity for SE Health leadership, to support business outcomes and to advance human capability across the organization. The position is a key enabler in the realization of our People Obsessed culture. Location: Hybrid; Majority remote, minimal in-office expectations (Markham HQ)About Us:At SE, we love what we do. Every day, we bring hope and happiness to clients, homes, and communities across Canada. We treat each person with dignity and love, like our own family; we build empathy; and we do the right thing. We are always inspired to make a difference. As a not-for-profit social enterprise, we share knowledge, provide the best care, and help each client to realize their most meaningful goals for health and wellbeing. We’re a great place to work, and we hope you’ll join our team.Why Join SE?Grow with us. SE health is a large (and growing) organization with diverse healthcare business lines across the country. You’ll have an opportunity – and will be supported – to do different types of work in different lines that will accelerate your development in a multitude of areas. And you’ll be an integral part in starting and growing our foundational People Analytics function.Develop yourself with SE. We have education bursaries, Tuition Assistance Programs, continuing education, training, and professional development to support your life-long learning and enhance both your skills and your capabilities. You’ll have an opportunity to develop through learning, through experience (successes and redo’s), and with the support of fantastic colleagues.Make a difference. SE Health is a Social Enterprise, which means that your efforts will directly contribute to the work the organization does to improve the lives of all Canadians. You’ll be joining an innovative organization where your ideas will always be heard, and where you’ll be supported to advance what you do and how you do it.Flexibility and Support. At SE, you’ll have the flexibility to balance your life. In this hybrid role you’ll primarily work-from-home with the ability to control your schedule. You’ll be supported with an environment, a culture, and a leadership team that exist to help you thrive and to be your bestCompetitive Compensation. Our Total Rewards package includes a competitive salary, group benefits, RRSP pension, and exclusive perks/discounts available only to SE Health staffRole:Using a variety of systems and tools, collect and transform HR and organizational data into actionable insights to support our people to thrive, and to provide the very best care and serviceSupport the identification, development, and reporting of people-related program performance metrics; including integration of evidence-based research and current business best practicesParticipate in key HR projects related to People; from focused work on recruitment and retention, to the launch and maintenance of a next generation Employee Experience programComplete various regular reports, government filings, and benchmark surveysApply a curious nature, excellent analytical skills, and superior problem-solving skills to human-related challenges; including taking data from various sources and aligning it to tell a storyAnalyze reporting procedures and identify improvement opportunities to advance data accuracy, report value, and actionable insights (i.e. improve your own function, continually)Qualifications:Post-Secondary education in HR, Business, Data Analytics or equivalent experience; certification in People Analytics considered a strong assetExperience with data reporting and analysis, ideally related to workforce data; data analysis work in an Oracle/People Soft environment a strong assetExpert level Excel and analysis skills; experience building/using queries, and performing data audit/integrity exercises to ensure data accuracy required.Strong technical competence with reporting tools/systems, and statistical analysis; Experience performing data analysis work with Business Intelligence (BI) software(s), and working with Taleo an assetSuperior self-motivation and drive to constantly improve the things you touch, to create greater impact and improve the level of service and support to our People and our PatientsHighly organized to manage accurate and timely tactical analysis and reporting, data integrity, and data auditing requirements; as well as support continuous improvement and key strategic people- and workforce-related programsPlease note that due to the unprecedented circumstance of the Global Pandemic and the resultant public health crisis; and in the interest of the health and safety of our patients/clients, employees, and greater good of public health, SE Health requires those that wish to work for this organization to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19. Fully vaccinated means a person has received both doses of the COVID-19 vaccine and it has been 14 days since the last doseSE Health is committed to the success of all its employees. If you feel you need accommodations because of illness or disability, please do not hesitate to contact Human Resources at humanresources@sehc.com at your earliest convenience.Please apply online effiechristidis@sehc.com

About Us :Established over 30 years ago, Medcan is a global leader in assessing clients' overall well-being and inspiring them to live well. Medcan has a comprehensive range of diagnostic assessments, which, in combination with innovative programs tailored to specific needs, are designed to successfully reach improved health outcomes.Over 80 physicians and specialists, alongside a broad roster of complementary health care disciplines, provide health and lifestyle management services on site and by video consult for individuals, families and organizations. Our team of 500 staff see clients physically and virtually from our downtown Toronto location.The Role: The Data Analyst is accountable for supporting Medcan’s analytics team for reporting and visualization of patient data for both internal and external clients. They will also support business leaders in developing performance reports and dashboards in Tableau, Salesforce, and Excel.The Accountabilities: Create and maintain business performance reports and dashboards for various lines of business using Salesforce and TableauCollaborate with Analytics team to ensure the availability of data extracts and live connections in Tableau serverGather requirements and present findings to business stakeholdersIdentify and report data structural errors to the technology services teamKeep information confidential. Comply with data integrity and security policiesThe Requirements: 1+ years’ experience as a Data Analyst, Business Intelligence, or similar role1+ years’ experience with creating Tableau dashboards, and reports using multiple data sources1+ years’ experience reading and writing complex SQL QueriesExperience using Salesforce reports and dashboards is required.Strong attention to detailClient-service orientedAbility to work in fast-paced environment and on project with tight delivery windowsAbility to learn new systems quicklySelf-sufficient individual with the ability to work well in cross-functional teamsAbility to QA data (post-processing and additional cleansing processes)This is a 12-month contract position scheduled to work full-time hours during business hours between Monday to Friday. The position will have a hybrid work set-up with opportunity to work from home and in the office.Our Benefits: Medcan’s philosophy of Live Well, For Life applies not only to our clients, but also our valued staff members. We provide paid Wellness Days along with a variety of programs to help our employees manage their mental and physical well-being. We offer special employee rates on fitness sessions, in-house specialty services, and a complimentary membership to our clinic to name a few.We also have employee perks to continue to help our staff Live Well, For Life. This includes complimentary group fitness sessions as well as an on-site healthy lunch program provided by our own food and catering brand, Nourish. We also provide interactive webinars hosted by our in-house experts focused on Eat, Move, Think. Our enhanced benefits package is just one of the reasons why we continue to be one of Canada’s Best Managed Companies!In your cover letter please include why you wish to align yourself with Medcan and how you believe you can add value to our organization.We thank all applicants for their interest; however only those selected for an initial interview will be contacted. No phone calls and no agencies please.Medcan is an equal opportunity employer committed to the principles of employment equity, diversity, and inclusion. We continuously work to provide a fair opportunity for all staff to participate and succeed at work, creating a sense of belonging, respect and a place that values the unique perspectives and lived experiences of each member of our team. We recognize the value of diversity in attributes such as age, gender identity and expression, sexual orientation and attractionality, ethnicity, race, colour, nationality, family and marital status, ability, religion and belief, freedom of thought, and any other characteristic that makes you unique. If these principles resonate with you, we encourage you to apply!If contacted for an employment opportunity, please advise your Talent Management Specialist if you require accommodation.Job Type: Full-time

Data Quality Analyst We are currently looking for a qualified candidate to assist the BI & Data Management Team’s operational and analytical needs. The Data Quality Analyst will work alongside the data warehouse and engineering team to provide data related support, data investigation, research, data management and data reporting. About IpsosIpsos is the world’s third largest market research company, present in 90 markets and employing more than 18,000 people. Our passionately curious research professionals, analysts and scientists have built unique multi-specialist capabilities that provide true understanding and powerful insights into the actions, opinions and motivations of citizens, consumers, patients, customers or employees. We serve more than 5000 clients across the world with 75 business solutions.Founded in France in 1975, Ipsos is listed on the Euronext Paris since July 1st, 1999. The company is part of the SBF 120 and the Mid-60 index and is eligible for the Deferred Settlement Service (SRD).ISIN code FR0000073298, Reuters ISOS.PA, Bloomberg IPS: FP www.ipsos.comDo you have an interest in learning more about medicines, medical technologies and advancements in healthcare?Would you like to work with a team of passionate problem-solvers dedicated to bringing research insights to life and a team of researchers who solely focus on healthcare?If all this sounds good so far, you could be just the person we’re looking for.As a Healthcare Market Research Analyst, you’ll get a chance to work with some of the world’s most recognized pharmaceutical and medical device companies, helping to solve their biggest challenges. You will be an integral part of this exciting work.We offer an innovative professional development opportunity to the qualified individual pursuing an exciting career path in market research.The Market Research Analyst is a diverse role ideal for someone ready to:Manage quantitative market research projects, within timeline and budgets, including working closely with colleagues in our Operations groups to oversee all operational components of projectsPerform quality checks at various stages of the research to ensure accuracyAssist with research and questionnaire designDevelop data plan analyses and perform data analysisPrepare reports and presentations in MS PowerPointDevelop an understanding of our clients’ business issues and the industries in which they operate.Helps senior members of team prepare proposals for many client research needs and works to translate them into an appropriate research designDon’t wait! Apply today if you have/are:Completed university/college degree in a related field (such as social sciences, pharmacy, biology or chemistry with an emphasis on health care) and/or relevant experience in the pharmaceutical and healthcare sectorA strong drive and interest in learning more about medical technologies, medical devise, and the overall advancement of the healthcare industryKnowledge of quantitative market researchOutstanding verbal and written communication skillsExcellent analytical skills and a high attention to detailSuperior organization skillsAdvanced proficiency with MS OfficeA self-starter who strives in deadline driven environmentExperience with SPSS is desirable, but not requiredIpsos’ Commitment to Diversity & InclusionIpsos recognizes the necessity of building an inclusive culture that values each employee’s individuality and diverse perspectives. For more than 40 years, our mission has been to generate and analyze data about society, markets, brands, and behaviors to provide our clients with the insights that elevate their understanding of the world. This could not be fulfilled without Ipsos’ diverse employees who compile and analyze this data—they are the essence of who we are and what we do.We are committed to providing equal opportunity to all employees, creating an environment that promotes inclusion, and allowing employees from all walks of life to flourish. Ipsos encourages our employees to act in a respectful and responsible manner, in line with codes of best practices concerning diversity and inclusion, human rights, equality, and civility for every individual.Ipsos is An Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or any other protected class and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability.

DescriptionLife At CoversWe’re a top digital media company, with a strong sense of purpose and a belief that success comes from the strength of our team and our culture. When we offer you a place on our team, it comes with a promise (well a few promises, actually):We’ll create opportunities for you to grow. We’re a rapidly-growing company so opportunities exist here, and we hold a firm belief that when you grow, we grow.Find the freedom to build something. We’ll give you the space to imagine and create, and to build our business and your career at the same time.Work alongside the best. Work and learn with people who are the best in their field, and who bring ambition and compassion in equal measure.Play hard to work hard. We know that you bring your best when you bring your whole self to work. We’re a wholehearted, inclusive team that invests in wellbeing and belonging.What Matters Most To Us:We understand that our industry is usually associated with a non-diverse persona. We have created, a workplace and community that brings fun, experience and opportunities for all. We welcome people of any gender, race, colour, religion or belief, ethnicity, sexual orientation, disability, or any other self-identifying group.Together we are guided by our values in all that we do. If you’re going to thrive here, fueling with fun, tackling it together, building your game and delivering a great experience will be as meaningful to you as they are to us.Why You Want This JobYou are a natural problem solver, who loves to bring data to the forefront to help solve real world problems. You will be a key contributor in putting analytics at the heart of every action we take in our business, by setting up the tools, reporting, and processes required to enable informed decision-making.As a Business Analyst you will gain exposure to a wide cross-section of our business. You will collaborate with product owners, subject matter experts, end-users, and technical team members in Product, Commercial, Marketing, and SEO. You will bring experience analyzing large data sets in a web/app business context and deliver insights that help us refine our products and strategies in the rapidly evolving sports betting market.While you are highly resourceful with solid technical skills, you will have the backing of an experienced and motivated team to help you get the job done. We are always looking for ways to improve, and this role will be key in focusing our efforts and getting innovative projects past the finish line.*What You'll Do*Aggregate and analyze data from multiple sources to provide insights for, and measure success of, key strategic functional (Product, Commercial, Marketing, and SEO) initiatives and campaigns.Partner with functional teams to ensure measurement capabilities are in place prior to a new marketing campaign, product launch, or other strategic initiative.Work with leading analytics tools to automate reporting & dashboards across the business, freeing up time to get the best insight from our data.Be the first point of contact for organizational KPI tracking; overhauling existing reporting and improving communication to strengthen alignment with organization objectives and key results.Provide market sizing, market segmentation, channel analysis and trend analysis across various industries and geographical regions.Create centrally housed training content and deliver training workshops for the wider team to encourage use of the full suite of data and intelligence tools.Define analytics processes and tooling requirements.What You'll Bring2+ years of related work experience in e-commerce analytics. Experience with digital analytics tools is a must (ie. Google Analytics or similar, SEM / SEO tools, etc.)Experience with visualization & BI tools (Tableau, PowerBI, Looker, Mode, similar)In-depth knowledge and experience using SQL, and ideally experience with R / PythonAble to see the 'big picture,' evaluate the business impact of issues and prioritize various requests.You can take complex, fuzzy problems and boil them down into concise and actionable insights, presenting the data in a way that makes people say “got it!”.Proactive with strong problem-solving skills and a keen eye for areas of improvement to streamline processes.Strong management, communication, technical and facilitation skills. Strong attention to detail. Able to effectively conduct technical discussions and present insights and recommendations to all levels of the business.Bachelor’s degree in a related field (ie. Computer Science, Business, Economics, Math, or Statistics)NICE TO HAVE: Experience in Python / R is a plusYou know your way around an analytics stack: you have worked with analytics tools (Adobe, Google Analytics), data warehouses (Snowflake, BigQuery, Redshift etc.), and data visualization tools (Tableau, PowerBI, etc).Ideally, you have a decent understanding of how Analytics teams work with Data Engineers to in building data warehouses and pipelinesTOOLS WE USE: Power BIAdobe AnalyticsSEO Tools such as; SEMrush, Google Search Console and ahrefsWhat We Can Do For YouCompetitive base salaryAnnual discretionary bonus based on company performance3 weeks’ vacation, public holidays off, birthday offHealth and dental benefits5% company matched pension contributionsSelf-driven yearly training budget so you can continue to grow professionallyFlexible working hours and work from home optionsCompany parties in the summer, winter, and a few fun events in betweenEngaging, fun, and casual company culture and dog-friendly officeRemote work available for the right candidateWe’re becoming the world’s leading sports betting authority by making smarter sports bettors.We’re a digital platform that brings together expert insight, rich user experience and a passionate community to help sports bettors bet smarter. In the overwhelming world of sports betting, we’ve created a single place where people who love the risk and rush of competition come together to share their passion and harness our 26 years of expertise, to build their game, win more consistently, and have fun doing it.We currently see 20 million sports fans visit our site annually, and our goals for the coming year are aggressive. We’ve doubled the size of our company in 12 months, and plan to do so again in the next 24.One thing is for sure: we’re set for a big next season.Covers.com is serviced by NS Sports Media Pros Ltd., a related company who specializes in professional services and is located in Halifax, Nova Scotia.Job Type: Full-time

(KPIs), queries to obtain the data, visualizations, and dashboard maintenance.Educate team members on data literacy to promote proper and relevant usage of dashboards and reporting while also maintaining a general understanding of team and project priorities.Collaborate with internal partners to identify and understand key data sources for analytics.What You Will Need:MBA or Master’s warehouses for analysis.Experience with infrastructure tools (e.g., Transactional Systems knowledge, data repositories, data catalogues)Experience with data management tools (e.g., integrations – analysis, predictive algorithms, clustering, and segmentation.Comfortable working in a fast-paced environment and interfacing with a broad set of stakeholders across various functions (i.e., Business, IT, Operations).Excellent verbal and written communication skills presenting complex analytical results to both technical and non-technical audiences.Why work with us? Job Status AuxiliaryAbout UsIf you are civic minded and interested in making an impact on people and businesses on the beautiful North Shore, consider working for the District of North Vancouver.Home to vast parkland and attractions including Grouse Mountain, Lynn Canyon and Capilano Suspension Bridge, the District is inspired by nature, and enriched by people. As one of BC’s Top Employers, this is an exciting time to join the District, as we embark on a range of initiatives to transform digital service delivery, customer experience, and our approach to climate action.Position OverviewWe are looking for an auxiliary Research Analyst (Climate Resilience) to join our new Climate and Biodiversity team for approximately 4 months commencing May 2022. This position is funded in part by the Pacific Institute for Climate Solutions (see eligibility criteria below).With your proven commitment to environmental protection and sustainability, you will assist with the advancement of the District’s climate protection projects and programs. You will compile and analyze data from various sources, research best practices, and prepare reports and submissions. A key focus will be to work with staff and departments across the organization to review implementation of the District’s Climate Change Adaptation Strategy, identifying actions completed or underway along with barriers and challenges. You will research and evaluate best practices regionally and beyond towards identifying key next steps towards increasing the District’s climate resilience. You will also assist with other related projects and programs.You have completed an undergraduate degree in environmental science, planning, business, or engineering. You have a sound knowledge of climate science and policy along with a proven ability to develop and execute research projects and gather and interpret information from a variety of sources, identify trends and best practices, prepare reports and provide recommendations based on findings. A sound knowledge of research methods, techniques and practices is required along with excellent knowledge of spreadsheets and statistical and analytical principles. You have an ability to translate complex and technical information into lay terms as you present your findings. Strong facilitation and writing skills are required along with exceptional interpersonal skills. Some evening/weekend work may be required.Salary range for this unionized position is $33.56-$39.50 per hour plus 12% in lieu of all benefits.If you have a passion to serve people and the community, and a demonstrated commitment to supporting a healthy and safe workplace, we would like to hear from you.This position is partially funded by the Pacific Institute for Climate Solutions (PICS). Eligible students must be enrolled in a fulltime undergraduate or graduate program at UVic, UBC, SFU, or UNBC, and must either be returning to complete their degree programs following the internship or have completed their programs the semester prior to the start of the internship.To support the health and safety of our employees and the public we serve, the District of North Vancouver has recently introduced a Mandatory COVID-19 Vaccination Policy. Compliance with this Policy is a required condition of employment.We thank you for your interest in employment with the District of North Vancouver and advise that only those shortlisted for an interview will be contacted.Compensation $33.56-$39.50 per hour plus 12% in lieu of all benefits.Posting Detail InformationPosting Number 22-03AJob Open Date 03/09/2022Job Close Date 03/25/2022Special Instructions to Applicants

Reference No. R2640057Position Title: Data Strategy & Operations Analyst (Open)Department: Data ProgramsLocation: Sanofi Pasteur Limited, TorontoSanofi Pasteur: The world’s leading vaccine companySanofi Pasteur, the vaccines division of Sanofi, is the largest company in the world devoted entirely to human vaccines. Our driving goal is to protect people from infectious diseases by creating safe and effective vaccines. Our company distributes more than 1 billion doses of vaccine each year, making it possible to vaccinate more than 500 million people across the globe. Sanofi Pasteur offers the broadest range of vaccines in the world, providing protection against 20 bacterial and viral diseases.Sanofi is dedicated to supporting people through their health challenges. We are a global biopharmaceutical company focused on human health. We prevent illness with vaccines, provide innovative treatments to fight pain and ease suffering. We stand by the few who suffer from rare diseases and the millions with long-term chronic conditions. With more than 100,000 people in 100 countries, Sanofi is transforming scientific innovation into healthcare solutions around the globe.Position Summary:The Data Strategy and Operations Analyst is an essential role in delivering on the various programs required to manage the global enterprise data program and enable the data strategy. As a part of the data strategy and operations team, the role includes translating business strategy into data and AI strategy, driving the business forward. As the strategy and operations team looks to identify key strategic objectives and programs, the data strategy and operations analyst will better define the business problem, work with product managers to shape products that enable a competitive advantage and establish a roadmap that enables key business KPIs. This role will also work to integrate and simplify operational insights across the global data team to provide relevant, fast, clear facts to the business to shape ongoing decisions. This role calls for creative problem-solving, analytics, strategic thinking, connecting the dots and outstanding relationship building to partner with cross functional teams.Key Responsibilities:Responsible for developing, operationalizing, and measuring strategies that enable Sanofi to develop unique data and AI products.Scale processes, build solutions and support major initiatives to launch platforms, modernize our foundations and build products.Manage portfolio of programs and financial operations of multi-million dollar programs, products and projects to deliver on strategy.Prepare, facilitate and lead to consensus and recommendations for critical data strategy initiatives.Collaborate with several cross-functional teams to bring initiatives to life both within the data team, and beyond with digital partners, global business units and global functions.Facilitate, manage and implement the design of a new operating model for data.Manage and maintain the data organizational roadmap to ensure it is on track and aligned with the evolving priorities of the organization.Leverage and engage resources across the organization to ensure Data Office priorities are delivered.Support planning Sanofi’s innovation agenda across various emerging technologies in data and AI, and develop new external partnerships.Key Requirements:University degree in STEM related field. Masters degree is an asset, along with professional designations and over four years of professional work experience.Demonstrated consulting experience, with relationship management.Comfort in navigating a matrixed organization with a fast-paced and ambiguous environment.Demonstrated techno functional data capabilities (data engineering, data science, architecture, cloud, data visualization).Experience leading cross-functional stakeholders to execute high-impact projects.Strong verbal and written communication skills.Bias for action, with excellent problem-solving skills, analytical and strategic capabilities.Ability to deal with ambiguity and work in autonomy with limited guidelines.Effective communication and interpersonal skills.Analytics and data technical skills.Strategic.Results driven.PMO skills.Data storyteller.Emotional Intelligence.Financial analysis.Self-driven, Results-oriented.Multi-Tasker.Eagerness to learn, inquisitive.Active listener.Rigor, attention to details.High work capacity / flexibility.Sanofi is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion. Our goal is to attract, develop and retain highly talented employees from diverse backgrounds, allowing us to benefit from a wide variety of experiences and perspectives. We welcome and encourage applications from all qualified applicants. Accommodations for persons with disabilities required during the recruitment process are available upon request.Thank you in advance for your interest.Only those candidates selected for interviews will be contacted.Sanofi, Empowering Life#GD-SP #LI-SPAt Sanofi diversity and inclusion is foundational to how we operate and embedded in our Core Values. We recognize to truly tap into the richness diversity brings we must lead with inclusion and have a workplace where those differences can thrive and be leveraged to empower the lives of our colleagues, patients and customers. We respect and celebrate the diversity of our people, their backgrounds and experiences and provide equal opportunity for all.

variety of data sources to identify trends and gaps that impact families and individuals in Elgin County, and to inform Social Services and strategic planning at the management level, both internally and externally.Provides analysis and recommendations to management in relation to the Ontario EarlyON portfolio and special needs resourcing.Leads the knowledge transfer of the Early Development Instrument (EDI) process (gathering data, analyzing data and training of EDI and other data) with staff and the community supporting knowledge mobilization and exchange as required.Produces comprehensive written reports for community, regional and provincial groups as well as relevant electronic media materials, as needed or requested.Ensures and maintains collection and retention of local and historical data, as required.Implements and coordinates outcome measures to evaluate program effectiveness in the early learning sector.Prepares statistics for tracking, planning, and ministry reporting requirements, as required.Assists, tracks and analyzes serious occurrences.Prepares and delivers regular reports and presentations to the community planning tables, community organizations, agencies, school boards, and the public.Maintains strong internal and external stakeholder relationships and facilitates engagement with community partners to support planning strategies for the integration of Social Services programs and to inform service system planning.Assists the Children’s Services Supervisor with the planning and development of Children’s Services policies and procedures, and the delivery of all related Children’s Services delivered by the department.This position must be compliant with all provisions of the Occupational Health and Safety Act, related to “Duties of a Worker.”Performs other related duties as may be assigned.QUALIFICATIONS:Post Secondary Degree in Business Administration, Education, or Public Policy. turning data into meaningful recommendations.Work autonomously to achieve our outcomes and manage your timelines, prioritizing between planned analytics projects and ad-hoc data requestsWork with finance, marketing, sales and executive teams to create new reports or enhance existing reports as required.Manage regulatory, financial and executive reporting processes.Create and manage automated validations testing suites on all reporting processes.Test programs or databases, correct errors and make necessary modifications to existing databases.Work with Software providers and Data & Analytics Lead to design and oversee automated processes using principles that are efficient, well structured, maintainable and easy to understand.Provide timely responses and solutions on issues that arise in day-to-day automated reporting processes.Proactively identify causes of poor data quality and implement and/or recommend activities to improve data quality with focus.Investigate data quality issues identified by data stakeholders as well as those detected by data quality monitoring rules.Documentation/Validation/Cleaning/Automation/AuditContinuously improve reporting implementation and adapt to changing technologies.Knowledge and Skills:University or college degree in Business, Finance, Computer Science or – quantitative/analytical related field.Experience in writing sophisticated SQL queries.Proficient with data visualization software, preferably Tableau.Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Excel including Pivot Tables, macros, formulas, and functions.Familiarity with programming language (R or Python, JavaScript) is an asset.Strong analytical skills; outstanding attention to detail - gathering and analyzing data.Excellent critical thinking and problem-solving skills – comfortable analyzing data across multi properties and identifying insights.Familiarity with databases and ETL concepts and processes. SQL/SSMS/SSIS/SSDT strongly preferred.Strong technical and business acumen and communication skills (both written and oral).Demonstrated ability to work cooperatively within a team setting to anticipate and help fellow colleagues, as well as working independently in a results- driven environment.Works well under pressure and can manage multiple tasks under time constraints.Focus / Initiative / Excellent communication skills.Ability to uphold confidential information.

JOB INFORMATIONRequisition ID: [[id]]Number of Vacancies: 1Department: [[division]] - [[department]]Salary Information: $75,602.80 - $94,494.40Pay Scale Group: 8SAEmployment Type: RegularWeekly Hours: 35 Off Days: Saturday and Sunday Shift: DayPosted On: March 24, 2022Last Day to Apply: March 30, 2022Reports to: Manager, PMOThe Toronto Transit Commission (TTC) is North America's third largest transit system and has been recognized as one of the top places to work in the GTA. Guided by a forward-thinking strategic plan, the TTC's vision is to be a transit system that makes Toronto proud. The TTC's recruitment efforts are directly aligned to its mission of providing "a reliable, efficient, and integrated bus, streetcar and subway system that draws its high standards of customer care from our rich traditions of safety, service and courtesy."General AccountabilityReporting to the Manager (Project Management Office) of the applicable TTC Group, the Analyst – PMO performs and/or coordinates the planning, monitoring, analysis and evaluation of project, program, and portfolio management functions for the applicable TTC Group. The position receives direction from the Manager or the Advisor – PMO to assist in the overall planning, management and administration of their department’s project portfolio to ensure the ongoing success of the TTC Project Management Maturity Plan.Key Job FunctionsPerforms and/or coordinates the planning, monitoring, analysis and evaluation of the applicable TTC Group’s project portfolio for efficiency and effectiveness, including coordinating the development, implementation and ongoing monitoring of project, program and portfolio schedules, cost and scope controls, performance measures and audit/quality assurance activities to ensure project management governance adherence.Collects information from stakeholders, including through interviews, and synthesizes information.Coordinates the identification and ongoing monitoring of key issues, including alignment with strategic objectives and performance measures.Conducts various operational analyses and cost/benefit studies.Conducts gap analysis (opportunity assessments and assists with action plans and change management.Interprets results of studies, and provides insights as to possible alternatives to correct deficiencies and improve efficiency.Prepares various reports, information and recommendations relating to areas of responsibility.Follows-up on action plans, produces Key Performance Indicators (KPIs), and prepares analysis of information and reports.Integrates, documents, evaluates and monitors new and/or revised operating and administrative policies, rules, standards and procedures, and assists with their implementation.Acts as a corporate/department resource and provides advice, direction and interpretation regarding policies, rules, procedures, standards and performance measures.Participates in feedback monitoring for the Project Management Framework and related Project Management documentation and activities.Conducts Project Management knowledge sessions, and coordinates the procurement and assignment of TTC and consultant resources where necessary.Monitors existing projects to ensure timely execution and completion by closely following project development and tracking that each stage is completed appropriately and within time and budget.Supports the Manager and/or Advisor in the overall planning, management and administration of the PfMO or PMO.Analyzes data and project information to identify critical areas for improvement and corrective action as well as other improvement opportunities/efficiencies, and assists with the implementation of corrective action.Collaborates with other TTC PMO peers, and liaises with internal/external contacts related to areas of responsibility.Researches information and prepares various reports and recommendations related to the work.Contributes to the achievement of TTC’s Project Management Maturity (PMM) mandate and supports the implementation of the Project Management Maturity (PMM) plan.Keeps abreast of project, program and portfolio management industry trends, best practices and new technology as related to areas of responsibility.Demonstrates behaviours that support diversity, inclusion, and a respectful work and service environment that is free from discrimination and harassment. Helps to remove barriers and accommodate employees and customers (within their area of responsibility) in accordance with TTC’s commitments and obligations under the Ontario Human Rights Code (OHRC) and Related Orders, the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA), and TTC’s policies.Participation in the TTC customer service Ambassador Program.SkillsApply analytical skillsManage projectsUse office technology, software and applicationsCreate, document, and manage information and recordsCreate and deliver presentations in various formatsCommunicate in a variety of mediumsEducation and ExperienceCompletion of a university degree in a relevant discipline, or a combination of education, training and experience deemed to be equivalent.Certification in a relevant technical discipline and/or certification as a Project Management Professional (PMP ), Business Analysis or a Master’s Degree are assets.Additional RequirementsRequires technical project management skills, including: requirements management and traceability, risk/schedule/scope management time, budget and cost estimation.Proficiency in software applications relevant to the work and area of responsibility (Project Online, Microsoft Project, Microsoft Visio, Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Access, SharePoint.Experience working in the enterprise or department level Project Management Office specifically on: developing and monitoring the use of the project management framework and its related standards and processes; using the project management information systems to highlight portfolio issues, risks, dependencies and continuous improvement opportunities.Must have or acquire knowledge of TTC/Department policies, practices and standards applicable to the work performedWorking knowledge of all major computer systems, and a familiarity with a wide range of information technology platforms and related technologies as well as keeping current with new technology and software associated with automation, monitoring and managing computer systems.Work experience in a Project Management Office setting is considered an asset.Strong communication skills to all levels of the organization.Presentation and Report building skills.Professional/Business writing skills is key.Must be able to conduct requirement gathering, provide services and build positive relationship with stakeholders at all levels in a professional manner.The TTC is committed to upholding the values of equity, diversity, anti-racism and inclusion in the delivery of its services and in its workplaces. The TTC is committed to fostering a diverse workforce that is representative of the communities it serves at all levels of the organization, and supports an inclusive environment where diverse employee and community perspectives and experiences bring value to the organization. The TTC encourages applications from all applicants, including members of groups with historical and/or current barriers to equity, including but not limited to, Indigenous, Black and racialized groups, people with disabilities, women and people from the LGBTQ(IA+) community. Please contact Human Resources – Talent Management at (416) 393-4570. Any information received related to an accommodation will be addressed confidentially.The TTC’s policy prohibits relatives of current TTC employees from being hired, assigned, transferred or promoted into positions, where there is a conflict of interest due to a relationship. Should you be selected for an interview, you will be required to disclose the name, relationship and position of any relative who is a current TTC employee.Note: All TTC Employees are required to be fully vaccinated as a precondition of employment in accordance with TTC's Mandatory Vaccination PolicyWe thank all applicants for their interest but advise only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

Support/Service Desk AnalystThis position is with IQVIA’s Privacy Analytics team in Ottawa, Canada. Located downtown in the heart of the National Capital Region, Privacy Analytics is on the cutting edge of data de-identification and re-identification research and we have translated this patented research into an amazing offering of software products and services that are enabling researchers to access healthcare data for analysis while ensuring individuals’ identities are protected.Our Java- and Scala-based flagship product sits on the cutting edge of technology and is a scalable, distributed enterprise engine built on Apache Spark that processes terabytes of data to conduct both mathematical calculations and data transformations. The work we do spans the entire spectrum of enterprise feature development, data analytics at scale, UI design and development, statistical modelling, and algorithm design all the way down to low-level algorithmic optimizations. We tackle technical problems that will engage and challenge the brightest minds, and we have very big ambitions ahead of us for which we’re expanding our team.In this role you will:Solve complex customer problemsAsk insightful questions that get to the root cause of the customer’s problemGenerate solutions using your product knowledge and our knowledge basesTake ownership of support incidents and use all available resources & knowledge to solve themConsistently improve the quality of your work by working with the feedback and coaching you receiveCollaborate with all teams (sales, implementation & development) to improve quality across productsStay up to date with emerging technologies and best practicesTo do this you will have:Analytical skills (problem analysis & trouble shooting)Ability to communicate confidently and effectively with our customersExperience troubleshooting and solving technical problemsCustomer advocacy, empathy, and keen attention to detailKnowledge of Operating Systems (Linux and Microsoft)Experience with Cloud Technologies (AWS & Azure)Degree or diploma in Engineering, IT related or relevant field5+ years experience in a technical support role covering enterprise software productsOffice Address: Laurier Ave W #200, Ottawa, ON K1P 5J6, Canada.#LI-RT1 #CareersWithPAIQVIA is a leading global provider of advanced analytics, technology solutions and clinical research services to the life sciences industry. We believe in pushing the boundaries of human science and data science to make the biggest impact possible – to help our customers create a healthier world. Learn more at https://jobs.iqvia.com

Data Analyst - Latin America Become a Monster (at what you do)!Hey there! We’re Mino Games, an international indie gaming studio composed of talented Monsters working from all around the world. We are currently assembling a remote Data Analytics department in Latin America. What Challenges Await You:Define metrics which meaningfully illustrate the overall business performance (KPIs) of our games, in-game events, marketing campaigns and much more.Generate high-value insights from the data and communicate them in a meaningful way.Analyze and explain major trends or patterns within the game.Support the user acquisition efforts by working closely with the marketing team.Support game monetization improvements by working closely with the product team.Translate business needs to technical requirements and A/B Tests, and work with development teams to ensure successful implementation.Identify potential business opportunities and design approaches to capture those opportunities.Promote data-driven decision processes in the whole company. A Bit About You:Field experience: B.Sc. Degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Economics, Engineering or equivalent experience; 2+ years of experience in a role as a Data Analyst.Tech: SQL, R or Python; Tableau or Periscope.Knowledge: English language proficiency; Measuring A/B Tests, basic regressions techniques.Basic knowledge of KPIs relevant to the mobile gaming industry or F2P applicationsPerks & Benefits:Training: We can offer training classes and workshops to develop and deepen your skills so you can continue leveling up.Independent Creativity: Mino Games is independent, which means we can be as creative as we want without being limited by client demands!Activities: Our Office Happiness Task Force will always surprise you with team and company-wide surprises and activities.Flexibility: We offer flexible work hours and work arrangements to encourage a healthy work-life balance.Company Hardware: We provide* you with some fancy hardware to get things done!More details within the interview.Mino Games hires on the basis of merit and is strongly committed to equity and diversity. We welcome applications from all qualified candidates. If you’re curious and would like to know more, apply!

nugget.ai is working in partnership with Planet4iT to recruit for our clients. nugget.ai and Planet4iT will be responsible for the application process, and our clients will be responsible for the interview and final selection processes.We are looking to hire a Senior Analyst – Data Architecture to join our Data Architecture team.You will take responsibility for managing our master data sets, developing reports, and troubleshooting data issues.To do well in this role you need a very fine eye for detail, experience as a data analyst, and a deep understanding of the popular data analysis tools and databases.Responsibilities:Performing analysis on data sets to submit findings and recommendations.Managing and designing the reporting environment, including data sources, security, and metadata.Suggesting potential improvements to the data capture process to increase operational efficiency.Providing technical expertise in data storage structures, data mining, and data cleansing.Processing confidential data and information according to guidelines.Managing master dataset, including creation, updates, and deletion.Leveraging data to provide detailed analysis, develop next steps.Tracking Performance and ROI by helping quantify the benefits.Supporting initiatives for data integrity and normalization.Producing various analyses on several projects.Requirements:University degree in business, with specialization in business intelligence or finance, accounting or economics.Ability to gather, analyze and synthesize data from various sources and efficiently present written assessments and communicate results and findings.Passion for complex data analysis and reporting. Understanding of addressing and metadata standards.Good knowledge of data management industry and data visualization tools. ( Tableau an asset )Support initiatives to continuously improve efficiency, workflow, processes, and procedures.Strong customer service skills, attention to detail and exceptional problem solving skills.Proven analytical thinking and ability to work effectively and efficiently.Ability to translate business requirements into non-technical terms.Good interpersonal, oral and written communication skills.Work experience as a data analyst or in a related field.

Pricing Data AnalystSummaryCandidate must be well-versed in analyzing pricing across the enterprise who has a solid 3-5 years of work experience investigating and identifying pricing issues using various custom query tools. The candidate will also be responsible for programming in mass price changes via list price or discount changes ensuring all processes are SOX compliant thus is also comfortable with using and learning custom software platforms.You will be joining a dynamic young team that is responsible for ensuring pricing is accurate across Canada. In addition, the successful candidate must have excellent communication skills as projects are coordinated across multiple departments spread across the globe. As a Pricing Data Analyst you will report directly to the Canadian Pricing Manager.Duties and Responsibilities:Responsible for doing the daily pre and post audit for individual Canadian plants, ensuring pricing is accurate.Responsible to track any corrective actions / remediation activities that are a direct result of discovered pricing irregularities.Perform one-off and mass price changes through LIST or DISCOUNT changes across multiple plants across the country using custom tools.Candidate must be able to thoroughly learn JELD-WEN’s window and doors offerings to ensure strong product knowledge.Ensure all activities and processes undertaken are SOX compliant, providing detailed auditable evidence gatheringHelp lead process changes across all plants to improve efficiency and compliance.Utilize multiple query tools to create pricing/sales reports and chartsResponsible for the creation and modification of detailed Standard Operating Procedures.QualificationsIntermediate to Advanced Microsoft Office skills - in particular, using Microsoft Excel for VLOOKUPS, FUNCTIONS and Pivot Tables.Strong knowledge of using multiple query tools to extract relevant customizable dataKnowledge and familiarity of working with ERP systemsStrong attention to detail and process management as pertains to IT and Business standards such as SOX Compliance, ITIL and AGILE.Comfortable using TICKETING systems to create, modify, assign tasks to users.Strong communication skills required as the position requires coordination across multiple plants to ensure processes are being followed and audit issues are fixed.Proactive go-getter who is able to properly time manage their daily tasks as well as network with all stakeholders with timely clear communication.Interested applicants are asked to send their resume, with salary and vacation expectations to hrtoronto@jeldwen.com with “Pricing Business Analyst” in the Subject Line.JELD-WEN is an equal opportunity employer and is committed to providing employment accommodation in accordance with the Ontario Human Rights Code and the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act, 2005 (AODA). JELD-WEN will provide accommodations to job applicants with disabilities throughout the recruitment process. If you require an accommodation, please notify us and we will work with you to meet your needs.

It offers a full range of financial products and services and is home to a wealth of expertise in property and casualty insurance, life and health insurance, wealth management, services for businesses of all sizes, securities brokerage, asset management, venture capital, and secure, leading-edge virtual access methods.Job LevelNV-10As a data analyst, you collect, process, analyze and use data that comes through different channels. You extract, describe, analyze and interpret the data needed to make informed business decisions.You lead stakeholders in projects for designing analytical solutions adapted to a wide range of business needs and in complex strategic data collection, processing and analysis interventions.You make recommendations on the planning and execution of operationally and conceptually complex analytical projects and initiatives that involve using your ability to use multiple databases, your analytical skills and your in depth, comprehensive understanding of the line of business and the organization.Your initiatives require extensive, in-depth knowledge of your line of work.You serve as a data use specialist advisor and subject matter expert for various stakeholders, and as a resource person and coach for decision-making bodies. You interact with many stakeholders in other fields to understand and communicate issues, and influence decision-making.General Information on the PositionOther working conditionsWork place : Currently regular telework because of the pandemic. Position located in Montreal. Job Title: Quality Assurance Analyst, Lead - Special Project (April 202...
Job Description: The Quality Assurance Analyst - Lead role is to develop and establish quality assurance standards and measures for the information technology services within the organization. This individual will also gather and analyze data in support of business cases, proposed projects, and systems requirements. This will include writing test plans and scripts for tracking defects and fixes in product development, software application development, information systems, and operations systems.The incumbent will apply proven analytical and problem-solving skills to help validate IT processes through careful testing in order to maximize the benefit of business investments in IT initiatives.RESPONSIBILITIES:The duties of this position will include, but are not limited to the following:Strategy & PlanningDevelop and establish quality assurance measures and testing standards for new applications, products, and/or enhancements to existing applications throughout their development/product lifecycles. Prepare and deliver reports, recommendations, or alternatives that address existing and potential trouble areas in IT systems and projects across the organization.Acquisition & DeploymentLiaise with vendors and suppliers in assessing applications and/or systems under consideration for purchase.Analyze documentation and technical specifications of any new application under deployment or consideration to determine its intended functionality.Operational ManagementConduct internal audits to measure and assure adherence to established QA standards for software development, application integration, and information system performance, and corresponding documentation.Create and execute test plans and scripts that will determine optimal application performance according to specifications.Verify and revise quality assurance standards as needed.Ensure that testing activities allow applications to meet business requirements and systems goals, fulfill end-user requirements, and identify existing or potential issues.Collaborate with software/systems personnel in application testing, such as system, unit, regression, load, and acceptance testing methods.Make recommendations for improvement of applications to programmers and software developers or engineers.Communicate test progress, test results, and other relevant information to project stakeholders and management.Test any new software to ensure integration into company systems meets functional requirements, system compliance, and technical specifications.Analyze formal test results in order to discover and report any defects, bugs, errors, configuration issues, and interoperability flaws.Assist in the development of change control processes, practices, and guidelines for new and existing technologies.Participate in developing, distributing, and coordinating in-depth end-user reviews for modified and new systems or applications.Cultivate and disseminate knowledge of quality assurance best practices.Other Duties as AssignedQUALIFICATIONS:The successful applicant must have: A University Degree/College Diploma or equivalent in such disciplines as Business, Commerce or a related field is required at the point of hire into this position. Minimum of 5 years’ experience functioning as a Quality Assurance Analyst or similar role, translating business needs into technical requirements and solutions in a private or public sector organization. Experience in scripting and developing test plans. Proficient in testing and tracking platforms such as JIRA,Jenkins etc. Experience in software testing frameworks. Strong communication skills. Able to adapt quickly with critical thinking and problem-solving skills Competency in soft skills such as influencing, teamwork, communication, and learning agility, allowing employees to switch rapidly between tasks, work closely with business partners, and contribute fully to business outcomes. Technical versatility to quickly evaluate and exploit new technologies and avoid becoming locked into legacy skills. Risk-tolerant, collaborative, and open mind-set. Demonstrated commitment and understanding of human rights, equity, diversity and inclusion with the ability to communicate and work effectively inter-culturally with diverse groups of students, employees and the community.Mohawk College is an equal opportunity employer that is committed to inclusive, barrier-free recruitment and selection processes. Should you require accommodation through any stage of the recruitment process, please contact the HR Department at (905) 575-2047.This position is governed by the applicable legislation of the Province of Ontario. Successful candidates will be required to conduct work within Ontario and must be available to work on campus as required, and will be required to follow Mohawk College’s vaccination policy.https://www.mohawkcollege.ca/covid-19-coronavirus/mohawk-colleges-covid-19-vaccination-policy-statementMohawk College is strongly committed to diversity within its community and especially welcomes applications from racialized persons/persons of colour, women, Indigenous People of North America, persons with disabilities, LGBTQ persons, and others who may contribute to the further diversification of ideas.

Marketing StatementA career at TransLink and our family of companies means working with people with a wide range of skills and perspectives, all teaming up towards a common goal: preserving and enhancing the region's world-envied quality of life. Together, we connect the region and enhance its livability by providing a sustainable transit and transportation network, embraced by our communities and people.At TransLink we are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of the communities in which we live. We’re committed to fostering an inclusive, equitable and accessible workplace, recognizing the unique value and skills every individual brings.Looking for a great place to work where your contributions are valued and you can make a difference in a vibrant city? At TransLink, one of BC’s Top Employers, you'll help make Metro Vancouver a better place to live, built on transportation excellence. Put your future in motion!ResponsibilitiesPerforms data analysis of Enterprise data and provides expertise and advice to business and BTS stakeholders on the application of Data Management practices and principles. Supports the enterprise Information Governance program. Performs detailed analyses of business areas to identify, understand, model and define data, business data flows and processes in conjunction with business and BTS stakeholders. Identifies data anomalies, patterns, overlaps and duplications and recommends improvements according to data management best practices and TransLink standards. Develops and implements data quality control and monitoring solutions to support data quality for the enterprise. Works with application support teams, the Data Warehouse team and system development project teams to offer Data Management expertise and services. Creates and maintains the conceptual, logical and physical data models that form the Enterprise data architecture and updates the corporate metadata repository, ensuring the integrity and consistent definition and use of Enterprise data. Keeps up to date with new developments in data management practices and technologies to support and improve data management services. Installs, maintains and administers tools and applications owned by the Data Management Team.QualificationsEDUCATION:Diploma in computer systems technology, with emphasis in database design, data modeling, systems analysis, system development methodologies and the use of C.A.S.E. tools.EXPERIENCE:Requires three (3) years previous experience in an environment where logical/physical data modeling, data analysis techniques, data management and business analysis skills have been demonstrated. Requires a further period of up to one (1) year in the position to become familiar with Translink’s business operations and environment and the business requirements for data and information.Other InformationRecruitment Process: An applicant will be required to demonstrate their suitability for this position by meeting the minimum level of qualifications and experience in order to be invited into the selection process. A standard interview format will be used including general, scenario and behavioural descriptive interview questions.COVID-19 SAFETY VACCINATION POLICYTo support public health, and protect the health and safety of our employees, customers, and their families, TransLink employees will be required to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 and will need to provide proof of full vaccination status in compliance with the employer’s COVID-19 Safety Vaccination Policy.Accommodations may be applicable under the BC Human Rights Code. Should an applicant be unable to provide proof of full vaccination and should an accommodation be requested, additional information will be required to determine whether the individual is entitled to be accommodated.Work Schedule37.5 hours per week.This is a full-time temporary position for 12 months.Work DesignationHybridThis position offers the flexibility of working both on-site and remotely within B.C.Rate of PaySalary starting from $7,044.00 monthlyThe Total Compensation Package includes Extended Health, Transit Pass and enrollment in the Public Service Pension Plan upon eligibility. Focus on your development through training, and mentorship programs. Enjoy a variety of health and wellness programs, including access to gym facilities. Speak to us to know more about what we offer.How to ApplyPlease click the 'Apply' button at the top right corner of the page or go to http://www.translink.ca/careers to apply for this position and view instructions on the process.INSTRUCTIONS: Please save your (1) cover letter, and your (2) resume as one pdf document prior to uploading your application on-line.Posting Date: 23 November 2021Closing Date: Open until filledPlease note that only those short listed will be contacted.Having trouble applying? Please view the System Requirements & FAQ's by going to http://www.translink.ca/careers.Equal Employment OpportunityWe are an equal opportunity employer committed to creating and supporting a diverse and inclusive workforce that is free of all forms of discrimination. We are committed to providing reasonable accommodations and will work with you to meet your needs. If you are a person with a disability and require assistance during the application process, please reach out! We celebrate our inclusive work environment and welcome members of all backgrounds, skills and perspectives.Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. For a confidential inquiry, simply email us at jobs@translink.ca .

Marketing StatementA career at TransLink and our family of companies means working with people with a wide range of skills and perspectives, all teaming up towards a common goal: preserving and enhancing the region's world-envied quality of life. Together, we connect the region and enhance its livability by providing a sustainable transit and transportation network, embraced by our communities and people.At TransLink we are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of the communities in which we live. We’re committed to fostering an inclusive, equitable and accessible workplace, recognizing the unique value and skills every individual brings.Looking for a great place to work where your contributions are valued and you can make a difference in a vibrant city? At TransLink, one of BC’s Top Employers, you'll help make Metro Vancouver a better place to live, built on transportation excellence. Put your future in motion!ResponsibilitiesPerforms data analysis of Enterprise data and provides expertise and advice to business and BTS stakeholders on the application of Data Management practices and principles. Supports the enterprise Information Governance program. Performs detailed analyses of business areas to identify, understand, model and define data, business data flows and processes in conjunction with business and BTS stakeholders. Identifies data anomalies, patterns, overlaps and duplications and recommends improvements according to data management best practices and TransLink standards. Develops and implements data quality control and monitoring solutions to support data quality for the enterprise. Works with application support teams, the Data Warehouse team and system development project teams to offer Data Management expertise and services. Creates and maintains the conceptual, logical and physical data models that form the Enterprise data architecture and updates the corporate metadata repository, ensuring the integrity and consistent definition and use of Enterprise data. Keeps up to date with new developments in data management practices and technologies to support and improve data management services. Installs, maintains and administers tools and applications owned by the Data Management Team.QualificationsEDUCATION:Diploma in computer systems technology, with emphasis in database design, data modeling, systems analysis, system development methodologies and the use of C.A.S.E. tools.EXPERIENCE:Requires three (3) years previous experience in an environment where logical/physical data modeling, data analysis techniques, data management and business analysis skills have been demonstrated. Requires a further period of up to one (1) year in the position to become familiar with Translink’s business operations and environment and the business requirements for data and information.Other InformationRecruitment Process: An applicant will be required to demonstrate their suitability for this position by meeting the minimum level of qualifications and experience in order to be invited into the selection process. A standard interview format will be used including general, scenario and behavioural descriptive interview questions.COVID-19 SAFETY VACCINATION POLICYTo support public health, and protect the health and safety of our employees, customers, and their families, TransLink employees will be required to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 and will need to provide proof of full vaccination status in compliance with the employer’s COVID-19 Safety Vaccination Policy.Accommodations may be applicable under the BC Human Rights Code. Should an applicant be unable to provide proof of full vaccination and should an accommodation be requested, additional information will be required to determine whether the individual is entitled to be accommodated.Work Schedule37.5 hours per week.This is a full-time temporary position for 12 months.Work DesignationHybridThis position offers the flexibility of working both on-site and remotely within B.C.Rate of PaySalary starting from $7,044.00 monthlyThe Total Compensation Package includes Extended Health, Transit Pass and enrollment in the Public Service Pension Plan upon eligibility. Focus on your development through training, and mentorship programs. Enjoy a variety of health and wellness programs, including access to gym facilities. Speak to us to know more about what we offer.How to ApplyPlease click the 'Apply' button at the top right corner of the page or go to http://www.translink.ca/careers to apply for this position and view instructions on the process.INSTRUCTIONS: Please save your (1) cover letter, and your (2) resume as one pdf document prior to uploading your application on-line.Posting Date: 23 November 2021Closing Date: Open until filledPlease note that only those short listed will be contacted.Having trouble applying? Please view the System Requirements & FAQ's by going to http://www.translink.ca/careers.Equal Employment OpportunityWe are an equal opportunity employer committed to creating and supporting a diverse and inclusive workforce that is free of all forms of discrimination. We are committed to providing reasonable accommodations and will work with you to meet your needs. If you are a person with a disability and require assistance during the application process, please reach out! We celebrate our inclusive work environment and welcome members of all backgrounds, skills and perspectives.Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. For a confidential inquiry, simply email us at jobs@translink.ca .

Data Analyst Graduate-33109ProfessionGraduatesWork LocationAmericas-Canada-MONTREALSchedulePart-timeDescriptionGraduate Data AnalystAs a Graduate Data Analyst, you will work on deep data analysis and consolidate structured information to support the strategic decisions related to all Southern America operations (Brazil, Chile, Argentina, Paraguay and Uruguay). You will interact with various teams from different countries to better understand the services, and directly contribute to operational improvement initiatives.Reporting directly to a Service Operations Director located in Brazil, you will be part of the Service Global Operations team in the AME region. You will be located in Montreal, with constant remote interaction with teams from Southern America.What you will do:Generate measurable Data and provide interpretation and insights:Data cleaning and preparation: to extract data from one or more sources and prepare the data so it is ready for numerical and categorical analysis. To handle missing and inconsistent data that may affect the analysis.Data analysis and exploration: to take operational questions or needs and turn them into data questions. To transform and analyse data to extract answers to those questions.Data visualizations: to create clean, visually compelling charts that will help others understand the data, avoiding things that are either difficult to interpret or can be misleading.To look to find interesting trends or relationships in the data that could bring value to the service operations.To look for patterns and blips in the data, finding improvement opportunities.To generate internal reports and/or dashboards (including monthly operational report for each airport), and reports to be used in customer presentations illustrating the operations performance and behaviour.QualificationsWho you areMust have a Degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Statistics or equivalent in-country qualification.Strong quantitative analysis backgroundFluent in Spanish and/or Portuguese is a strong plusExcellent communication skillsProven ability to work in multiple high priority tasks at onceDetail orientedHigh degree of proficiency in Excel / PowerBIHighly organized to achieve objectives, with the strong ability to convey complex information to its peers, who may not be technical or financial oriented.Knowledge of Information Technology and Telecommunications is a plusITIL Foundation Certificate is desirableWhat you can expectParticipate in front-line executive meetings allowing you great exposure to different teams and technologies.Get assigned to a Buddy and a Mentor that will guide you throughout your Graduate experience.Be a part of a Graduate community – both local and global.Have access to both Technical and soft skills development training.What we offerSITA’s workplace is all about diversity: many different countries and cultures are represented in our workforce, and colleagues who’ve been working here for decades collaborate with those just out of college and early in their careers. SITA is a place of change and constant improvement, where we're always pushing ourselves to find better ways of doing things: smarter, quicker, easier, for us and our customers and for their customers too.And we offer all the good stuff you’d expect like holidays, flexible benefits, medical policy, and access to world class learning.Competitive salary in addition to an extensive benefits package.Welcome to SITASITA is the world’s leading specialist in air transport communications and information technology. We don’t just connect the global aviation industry. We apply decades of experience and expertise to address almost every core business, operational, baggage, and passenger process in air transport. We design, build, and support technology solutions all with one vision to create easy air travel every step of the way. As an organization, we cover 95% of all international air travel destinations and work with over 2,800 air transport and government customers in every corner of the globe. Are you ready to explore the opportunities?Job PostingMar 25, 2022, 8:28:55 AM
