Ledcor Employee? Apply internally in Workday.DescriptionJob Summary:We are looking for an analytical superstar to join our Compensation team as a Compensation Data Analyst. Our employees are the key to our success, and it is imperative that as a business Ledcor is keeping up to date with Compensation trends. By analyzing both internal and external data, this role will support the creation of a data driven understanding of the compensation landscape, which will enable our Leadership team to make informed decisions that will help us to attract and retain employees.As our new Compensation Data Analyst, you will be reporting to the Senior Manager, Compensation & HR Projects (Manager), to provide insightful analysis on compensation data from a variety of sources. This role will be responsible for taking the initiative to find trends, patterns, and opportunities for compensation at Ledcor.Bring your extensive Data Analytics experience to this impactful role and join our True Blue team today! This role can be based in Alberta, British Columbia, Saskatchewan or Manitoba and will be a home-based position with the understanding you may be required to attend office as business needs dictate.Responsibilities:Compensation Analysis and Insight (50%)Collect, combine, mine and analyze disparate datasets and metrics from a variety of sources, including Salary Surveys, Workday, JDE, Recruitment, Business HR, exit Interviews etc to detect underlying labour market trends and Ledcor compensation data trends with a view towards more effective and efficient compensation analytics using statistical analyses, predictive modeling, and forecastingWorking with the Manager to develop a plan to incorporate non-traditional data sources into our analysis. Monitor social media (Glassdoor, LinkedIn) to monitor what employees are saying about Ledcor’s pay practicesConducts ad hoc compensation analyses (exploration projects) on Operating Group compensation related concernsIdentify key business drivers impacting compensation patternsMonitors the effectiveness of existing compensation practices and recommends changes that are cost-effective and consistent with compensation trends and corporate objectivesCompensation Program Enhancements (25%)You will perform analysis on components of compensation, change initiatives and provide support to compensation program enhancements by conducting data analysis to support timely data driven decisionsTakes initiative to identify gaps in, or opportunities for improving, our compensation programs, tools and guidanceEngage with our internal customers (Business HR and Recruiting) to understand their needs, solve compensation challenges and ensure successful deployment of compensation programsCompensation Communication & Training (25%)Execute on compensation communication plans in order to ensure that leaders and employees have the right level of knowledge (including training across key stakeholder groups and employees)Supports the preparation of reports and presentations of findings for the Board, Senior Executives, Operating Group Leaders, HR Leadership teams with compelling data visualizations and narrativesSupports training activities within HR to increase awareness, understanding and capability for compensation practices within the HR teamRequirements:4 years related experience in Compensation, Financial or Data AnalysisA Bachelors degree in a relevant field such as Finance, Accounting, Data Science or StatisticsExperience working with Workday, SAP and Power BI is highly desirableExperience with applied statistics skills, such as distributions, statistical testing, regression, etc.Ability to understand and analyze large datasets. Experience processing, cleansing, and verifying the integrity of data used for analysisComfortable with ambiguity and developing creative solutions to business questionsExcellent ability to visually present and communicate data, analyses, and findingsExperience with Power BI preferredAbility to identify, analyze, and resolve problems logically and systematicallyStrong attention to detailExcellent interpersonal, communication and presentation skillsAbility to work in a fast paced, complex organization and meet deadlinesAbility to maintain discretion and confidentiality with sensitive employee informationAbility to work independently and be part of a cross-functional team environmentExpertise in Microsoft Office SuiteWorking Conditions:Occasional event-related travel may be requiredAdditional Information:Company DescriptionThe Ledcor Group of Companies is one of North America’s most diversified construction companies. Ledcor is a company built on a rich history of long-standing project successes.But when you work for Ledcor, your experience will go far beyond the project. Do you want a career that means more? Join our True Blue team now!Employment EquityAt Ledcor we believe diversity, equity, and inclusion should be part of everything we do. We are proud to be an equal-opportunity employer. Data AnalystDepartment of Education and Early Childhood DevelopmentPermanentOpenFredericton / RemoteAny candidate not currently employed in the New Brunswick Public Service will need to provide proof of full vaccination against COVID-19, or a valid medical certificate exempting them from the vaccine.Who we are:The work we do has a positive impact on our communities, and helps improve the everyday lives of New Brunswickers. Together, we are over 45,000 New Brunswickers who are passionate problem-solvers, who make a difference and are proud to call New Brunswick home.The mission for New Brunswick public schools is to have each student develop the attributes needed to be a lifelong learner, to achieve personal fulfillment and to contribute to a productive, just and democratic society.What you will do:As a member of the Assessment, Analysis and Design Services branch, the successful candidate will be responsible to ensure:Data received by the branch is ready to use for analysis, reporting, and sharing; Ensuring that it conforms to the established standards for each data set, is appropriately labelled, and standard conversions are applied.Data holdings of the branch are appropriately managed by developing data standards/dictionaries (in collaboration with the Statistician, Director, and Data Specialist), developing, documenting, and adhering to file naming and storing conventions, and complying with data security and privacy legislation requirements.Data collection mechanisms are effective for the purpose for which data is to be used and efficient for those from whom data is collected.Annual data reports and ad hoc requests for data, analysis, and reports are complete, accurate, informative, aesthetically pleasing, and provided on time. This includes finding innovative approaches to communicating and sharing the results of analyses.Ongoing liaison with internal clients, school district personnel, vendors and other organizations.The successful candidate will be responsible for:Basic data analysis using SPSS and ExcelResearching, selecting, and using the most appropriate technology to conduct surveys and other data collectionMerging datasets and migrating existing dataDesigning databases for longitudinal analyses under direction of the PsychometricianProducing graphs, writing reports, and creating presentationsSummarizing PISA (Programme for International Student Assessment), PCAP (Pan-Canadian Assessment Program), and other reportsCollating data from sources such as Statistics Canada and the New Brunswick Health CouncilConducting jurisdictional scans to gather background information on various topicsWork environment:Office location: 250 King Street, FrederictonOffice layout: cubiclesRemote work within New Brunswick is a possibilityStandard hours of work: Monday - Friday, 8:15-4:30We promote a scent-reduced environment.Who you are:You possess strong interpersonal and communication skills, the ability to problem-solve creatively and to think on your feet. You have a respect for safety, you treat people in a polite and professional manner being courteous and always showing kindness. You are concerned for the wellbeing of New Brunswickers. You are excited by the application of data analyses to real-world contexts and enjoy formulating and testing hypotheses.Your attitude, skills and interests are just as important as your area of study. We are looking for diverse backgrounds that bring a combination of the following:Need to have:University degree or Diploma in statistics, mathematics, psychology, sociology or a related field.A minimum of three (3) years of experience manipulating and summarizing datasets, with proficiency in IBM SPSS and Excel, and basic knowledge of statistics and quantitative research methodology. An equivalent combination of education, training and experience may be considered.Written and spoken competence in English is required. Please state your language capability.Applicants must clearly demonstrate the essential qualifications to be given further consideration. Please ensure that preferred language for assessment is identified on your resume.Nice to have:Experience working with Microsoft SharePoint including InfoPath, Office 365, and Power BIProgramming skills in Visual Basic.Net, SQL, or a similar programBehavioral Competencies:Results Orientation;Effective Interactive Communication;Analytical Thinking and Judgment;Concern for Order.Technical Competencies:Knowledge of Research Methodologies, Principles and PracticesSpecialized Subject Matter Expertise and KnowledgeWritten CommunicationWage:Pay Band 3 - $47,710 - $66,690 annuallyWhat can GNB offer you?Comprehensive benefits package and the Public Service Shared Risk Pension Plan.Opportunities for career growth, professional development and training.Free access to Employee and Family Assistance Program (EFAP) and services1 paid Volunteer Day per year to give back to your community.1.25 days/month of paid vacationProviding a safe workplace for all. Location: Remote in Greater Toronto Area, ON
Job Description: At Yelp, it’s our mission to connect people with great local businesses. From a coffee connoisseur’s review of a neighborhood cafe, to a homeowner’s request for a quote to remodel their kitchen, Yelp’s data captures millions of user-business interactions every day.The Data Science & Analytics team prides itself on harnessing the power of this data. We test and learn, build tools and lead meaningful analyses to extract insights that influence Yelp’s product and business strategy.We’re looking for a self-motivated critical thinker whose intellectual curiosity is met with a healthy dose of skepticism. You value the integrity of your work, sanity check analyses before drawing conclusions, and take pride in telling stories with data. You are a team player who is an excellent communicator, quick learner, and as excited about Yelp as we are.We’d love to have you apply, even if you don't feel you meet every single requirement in this posting. At Yelp, we’re looking for great people, not just those who simply check off all the boxes.Vaccination against COVID-19 is not required for this role. We nonetheless encourage all employees to get vaccinated. Employees who are not vaccinated may not visit Yelp’s offices or participate in any in-person work activities, and are not eligible to transfer or be promoted to a role that requires vaccination.Where You Come In:Lead broad analytics projects core to Yelp’s business, communicate key insights to decision makers, and help product leaders uncover new opportunities.Manage tight deadlines and quickly iterate analyses to answer unstructured business questions, deliver actionable learnings, and make strategic recommendations.Work cross-functionally with product and engineering to define, log, and track Yelp’s key product metrics and opportunity size new initiatives.Generate dashboards and automate reports that empower teams across the organization to make data-driven decisions.Grow and maintain impactful relationships with stakeholders of both technical and non technical backgrounds with clear and frequent communication.Think critically about experimental design and advocate for thoughtful experimentation.What It Takes to Suceed:BA/BS or graduate degree in a quantitative field (mathematics, statistics, economics etc.)3+ years of quantitative industry experience, ideally within the consumer product spaceExcellent SQL skills, fluency in Python, and experience with at least one statistical package (R, Pandas/NumPy/SciPy/matplotlib, Stata, Matlab).An eye for compelling data visualization and extensive experience with related tools (Tableau, Mode, Looker).Solid understanding of statistical inference, experimental design and analytic bias. Familiarity with financial modeling and advanced statistics (regression, non parametrics, predictive modeling) a plus.Local businesses are turning to Yelp because we’re uniquely positioned to help them reach their customers during these challenging times. Our Engineering & Product teams have responded by quickly identifying their needs and building innovative products and features to support them. Our commitment to connecting people with great local businesses has never been stronger.#LI-RemoteAt Yelp, we believe that diversity is an expression of all the unique characteristics that make us human: race, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, religion, disability, and education — and those are just a few. We recognize that diverse backgrounds and perspectives strengthen our teams and our product. The foundation of our diversity efforts are closely tied to our core values, which include “Playing Well With Others” and “Authenticity.”We’re proud to be an equal opportunity employer and consider qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, ancestry, age, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital or family status, veteran status, medical condition, disability, or any other protected status.We are committed to providing reasonable accommodations for individuals with disabilities in our job application process. If you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, you may contact us at accommodations-recruiting@yelp.com or 415-969-8488.

Nous ne pratiquons aucune discrimination fondée sur la base de tout motif de discrimination interdit applicable, y compris, mais sans s'y limiter, la race, la religion, la couleur, l'origine nationale, le sexe, l'orientation sexuelle, l'âge, l'état civil ou le handicap. About ThinkDataThinkData Works Inc. is a Toronto-based technology startup whose data management platform, Namara, is used by some of the foremost organizations in the world to process and refine data into usable products. We host one of the largest repositories of publicly available data - including the world’s largest repository of COVID-19 data - and enable our clients to significantly increase the amount of information they use to fuel solutions. We’ve raised more than $11 million in financing from world-class venture capital firms including First Ascent Ventures, Yaletown Partners, Extreme Venture Partners, and the BDC.Our tech, our growth, and our team have been acknowledged for their excellence through various industry awards including being recognized as one of Canada's Top Growing Companies by the Globe and Mail, one of Canada's Most Admired Corporate Cultures by Waterstone Human Capital, and the Overall Data Science Solution of the Year by Data Breakthrough Awards.About the RoleWe are looking for a Data Analyst to join our Data Team on a contract basis. This role will join our Toronto HQ, and will involve hands-on data wrangling, ingestion and analysis. Our ideal candidate wants to be part of a team that solves real-world problems and enables clients to use better data and use data better. This position will report to the VP of Data and will work closely with the sales team.Job ResponsibilitiesReporting to the VP of Data, and working under the guidance of a senior Field Data Scientist, the Data Analyst plays a key role in the delivery of data products and solutions by:Conducting research to identify data sources and data products for specific client requirementsIngesting and enriching the data on the platformBuilding connectors to data sources, QA-ing and wrangling datasets to conform to ThinkData standardsJob RequirementsDesign and build data products. You are currently enrolled in or have a relevant degree such as Statistics or Mathematics or Data Science and have working knowledge of Python and/or Ruby.Wrangle data. You are familiar with data wrangling using scripts and a variety of tools, such as Pandas, OpenRefine or similar.Collaborate. You can work as part of the team or work autonomously. You are adaptable, flexible, and able to adjust to a dynamic startup environment. Previous experience working at a startup environment is an assetEvolve with us. The landscape is being built under our feet as we move forward, so we need people who can channel their passion, learn quickly, and navigate the unknown at top speed.Must be eligible to work in CanadaWhat’s in it for you?Competitive compensation. You will earn a salary commensurate with your experience.Career development. We believe in informal mentorship and formal training. You will work closely with our VP of Data and have the opportunity to participate in lunch-and-learn workshops.The opportunity to make a mark. We are growing. And with that growth comes the need for people with insights to help us scale. You will have the opportunity to apply your insights, try different methods and introduce best practices, building out a framework for our Data Team.An amazing team. Collaboration across teams is paramount to our success and our culture as we scale. At ThinkData Works, we prioritize mental and physical wellness. We believe in balance as we grow. We play Smash Bros, pool, and board games. We know how to have fun and enjoy spending some extra time together.Need more reasons to join?We may be technologically driven, but like any good Canadian we know the best ideas are thought of up north in a cottage. Before (and hopefully after) COVID-19, we’ve taken annual 3-day retreats for mission setting, aligning with our goals, product management and team building. We’re not saying this involves a beer keg, guitars and campfires. But we’re not saying it doesn’t.We are managing our growth. We continue to promote and nurture the open, collaborative nature of who we are and how we work. And we don’t just support each other in the office. The number of musicians in-house is pretty overwhelming, from big band trumpeters to death metal guitarists. There’s always a co-worker with a gig coming up and we go out to cheer them on.Some final notes before applyingThinkData Works is an equal opportunity employer and encourages applications from members of all backgrounds and perspectives. Accommodations are available on request for candidates with a disability taking part in all aspects of the application process. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, colour, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, marital status, disability, or national or ethnic origin.We value all of our applicants, but due to the high volume of applications we receive, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.COVID-19 updateAt this time, we are conducting all interviews remotely and most of the team continues to work from home. Our Toronto and UK offices are now adapted to follow social distancing guidelines to keep the team safe. When government restrictions allow, employees have the option of working from the office a few days per week.

Fishtech Group + Herjavec Group are here to provide cyber security products and services to enterprise organizations. We have been recognized as one of the world’s most innovative cybersecurity leaders, and excel in complex, multi-technology environments.Do you thrive in agile, fast-paced environments?Are you passionate about protecting the company and client information?Are you one to step up to challenges?Do you have what it takes to work for a shark?If so, APPLY TODAYRole SummaryThe Data Analyst reports directly to the Director, Business Intelligence & Analytics, and is responsible for the creation and implementation of business intelligence solutions, which may consist of compilation and storage of business data, development, and maintenance of queries and reports, as well as deep-dive analysis. This person works across functional areas to ensure quality and consistency in services.Key ResponsibilitiesProduction of accurate and timely strategic reporting; forecasts, projections, operational metrics, and high-level overview to business units, clients, and management.Develop, produce and review scheduled and ad hoc reporting as required by utilizing available tools and technology.Field queries from business partners across the organization.Provide support and data solutions to various departments as required via analysis and communication, acting on requests for data and reporting information.Provide guidance on the structure of data sources, drafting of queries, compiling of operational type business intelligence data to various departments.Handle all requests with a high standard of quality and professionalism; determine the best course of action to ensure resolution meets established standards.Act as a subject matter expert (SME) for reporting requirements as they relate to the needs of the organization.Coordinate activities with business units.Provide analysis and interpretation in clear user language on data information and provide written summary reporting as well as communication of the analysis.Synthesize large datasets into a clear consumable format for business units and management.Document activities as required in compliance with established controls, delivery schedule, process documents, etc.Analyze and understand the root cause of problems to propose and implement solutions in order to resolve system and data source issues. Assist developers and support teams.Maintain knowledge of business unit policies and procedures, systems, and requirements.Identify opportunities for process improvements, document them, and collaborate with the team to move them forward.Participate in department objectives; including quality and productivity standards and other duties as assigned within the department.Qualifications3+ years of experience designing and developing Business Intelligence Reporting and Data Visualization Solutions.3+ years of experience working on ETL jobs.3+ years of experience working on relational databases and writing SQL queries.3+ years of experience using Microsoft BI stack (SSAS, SSRS, Power Pivot, Power View, Power BI)3+ years of experience with related scripting languages and techniques (Python, PowerShell, Rest API, etc.)3+ years of experience working with cloud technologies for data pipelines, data warehouses.Post-secondary diploma or degree in a computer science-related field.Knowledge in reporting or dashboard solutions with BI tools (Power BI preferred).Experience with ServiceNow is considered an asset.Experience with unstructured data (JSON) is considered an asset.Ability to write and edit clear and concise reports, meeting minutes, and technical documentationBe self-motivated, organized, and detailed oriented.Strong leadership and motivational skills.Strong written and verbal communication skills.Strong problem-solving and diagnostic skills.Ability to be a strong team member and communicate effectively.Ability to prioritize and multi-task, and reasonably estimate work effort for tasks.An interest in, and comfort with, technical concepts related to network and information security.Why Fishtech Group + Herjavec Group?Nurturing ambitionOur organization is agile and adaptive, supporting and encouraging ambition, the pace of your career is completely in your control.Accelerate your Cyber Security careerYour learning pace at is rapid and you will be exposed to all areas of the security domain, as our projects are varied both in nature, size, and location. You could be running a security health check, implementing the latest end-user security solution, or working with the client’s management team to develop a 3-year security strategy. You will be working in a team that contains subject matter experts who have spent a lifetime working in Cyber Security across the world.Culture for the next generationThe general culture at Fishtech Group + Herjavec Group is to promote talent from within, so we encourage personal development via training, mentoring, and time from senior management to build our capabilities with our team. We embrace flexible working, and regular team building days and socials.Be inspiredFinally, we are passionate about IT Security and technology. The technology world is evolving rapidly, and we hope to show you how our team embraces technology change and turns it into successful solutions that solve complex business problems.We work hard with integrity, but recognize success is a team effort where each of us supports others. It is important that we enjoy what we do.What We Look for: Motivated to accelerate your careerYou have genuine interests in Technology and are eager to take control of your career and supercharge it in the world of IT SecurityEffective CommunicationYou have the ability to communicate effectively with people of different backgrounds to you. Both in written and verbal communication, you provide a clear impact that is understood.Work with IntegrityWe work to the best of our ability in an ethical manner, adhere to processes and regulations, and challenge anything that you believe to be unethical.Embrace TechnologyYou embrace new technology and ways of working. Curious about how new technology can be used to solve business problems.Contribution and CollaborationBe a strong team player, support others within your team, and share your knowledge within the organization.Career Development and TrainingAt Fishtech Group + Herjavec Group, we provide support to help you along your career path, ensuring you remain in control of your professional and personal development. This is important to use that you feel confident in your day-to-day activities, and you reach your full potential.Employee peer supportWe employ official mentor schemes for junior members of staff to help them learn about the organization and work effectively in their role. There are collaboration groups for knowledge sharing and developing alternative professional interests.Professional QualificationsWe encourage obtaining professional qualifications and accreditations. These qualifications are great for your professional development, client assurance they are dealing with a trained professional, and good confirmation of your new skills.Technology EnablementWe have extensive product and technology training courses that we use for internal and external training. Our training provides in-depth real-life training modules that ensure you are fully enabled to excel in your role.Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

At Janssen, we are dedicated to addressing and solving some of the most important unmet medical needs of our time in oncology, immunology, neuroscience, infectious diseases, pulmonary hypertension, metabolic and chronic diseases. Driven by our commitment to patients, we bring innovative products, services and solutions to people throughout the world. Janssen Inc. is a member of the Pharmaceutical Companies of Johnson & Johnson.Position Overview:This position is responsible for supporting trade activities at the tactical level and driving commercial operations strategy at Janssen. This position will also serve as support for the internal and external dealings pertaining to our Established Medicines Group Brand Marketing activities.Core responsibilities:External/Internal Partnerships – Ensure data integrity and adequate data flows between Trade Partners and Janssen. Report Direct Trade Partner adherence to Distribution Services Agreements (inventory plan execution, service fees, distribution service value, trade data and market share). Report on Trade Partners performance metrics. Interacts and collaborates with internal business partners across functions (Deliver, EMG Brand Team, BioAdvance, Market Access, Medical Affairs). Participate in Eprex BIM by supporting in identifying insights and building vibrant presence amongst cross functional colleagues. Develop and implement Eprex marketing materials to support Renal customers through a new and innovative online platform.Data Analytics and Insights – Leverages Trade Partner data to analyze & interpret data, identifying actionable insights to develop/create innovative business opportunities, driving value back to patient. Ensure integrity of information flowing from wholesalers into Janssen Qlik environment. Analyze daily Trade Sales to ensure purchases are aligned with individual Brand demand. Prepare weekly shipment/inventory reports, delivering key updates and insights to week over week changes. Support revenue forecasting process for annual and long-range Brand strategic business planning. Live the culture of data by signaling opportunities and threats and predicting trends based on evidence generated through multiple data sets. Gather and analyze clinical and marketplace insights to support and develop competitively differentiated commercial strategies.Commercial Operations – Supports Janssen supply chain processes to deliver product to Trade Partners/Pharmacies/Patients, in full and on time, ensuring standardized workflows. Supporting activities of bill-back processes; analyzing pricing from customer distribution networks ensuring appropriate pricing claims are received from customers and validated; Identify variances, escalates to management when necessary. Identify and execute new innovative and disruptive solutions to a variety of complex problems in an evolving market (returns, contracts, cross border trade, etc..).QualificationsQualifications and professional capabilities:Pursuing a university degree or MBA in engineering or businessHigh level of proficiency in excel required (excel aptitude test may be requested)•Results and performance driven, who demonstrates personal ownership and accountability for delivering business results and disruptive innovationStrong analytical skills, generating easy to interpret reports. Use statistical methods to identify areas for operational improvements and suggested market insights to Business Units.Strong communication skills, ability to influence change with diverse audiencesDemonstrate ability to self-direct, act with sense of urgency and agilityStrong attention to detail•Bilingual is an asset but not requiredJohnson & Johnson is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, or protected veteran status and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability.For more information on how we support the whole health of our employees throughout their wellness, career and life journey, please visit www.careers.jnj.com.]Primary LocationCanada-Ontario-Toronto-19 Green Belt DriveOrganizationJanssen Inc. (7710)Job FunctionGeneral AdministrationRequisition ID2206019260W

Comapny Name: iA Financial Group / iA Groupe financier
Job Description: Summer 2022 Intern - DeveloperAt iA Financial Group, you will have all the tools you need to reach your goals and take part in an internship that meets your expectations.You will start your career in a fast-growing company and you will work with a multitude of technological tools and team members who will be happy to be your mentors.At iA Financial Group, there are over 1000 employees in the information technology (IT) team.You think that working for an insurance company is dull and lacks challenges?Think again and read the following!The duties would include:Develops a methodology for the ongoing assessment of database performance and the identification of problem areas.Develops a security scheme for the database environment, as well as assisting in disaster recovery if necessary.Perform health checks to ensure the integrity of the schema and the dataPerform health checks to ensure the synchronization of database replicasLiaise with other infrastructure teams to resolve complex application performance analysisDevelop and maintain the appropriate operational documentation for databasesImport, update and export large data filesWrite scripts, functions, stored procedures using SQLAnalyze project/task requirements to determine how data should be organized, who should have access to different data and how it should be organizedWrite SQL statements for adhoc reportsPrepare weekly, monthly, quarterly management reportsDeveloping and deploying DTS/SSIS/SSRS packagesBuild jobs using 24/7 schedulerWHAT DO YOU NEED TO HAVE?Current: Bachelor's degree (BAC) in computer science, software engineering, computer engineeringCurrent: Interest in Project Management tools and methodologies is an asset, basic understanding of MS Office productivity tools, including Outlook, Excel, Word and PowerPointExperience with SQL Server EnvironmentFamiliarity with Visual Basic, C#, Java and .NET programming languagesBe looking for an eligible internship that will be credited towards your training.WHAT WILL YOU GET?WORK MODE: Flexible - AGILE/SCRUM approach in a LEAN context (continuous improvement) combined with more traditional methodologies – we’re in an exciting transformational stage!TRAINING: no worries, we take care of your integration in the team and your training (you can't know everything already!).CONDITIONS: flexible schedule, social activities and, if everything goes back to normal, a low-cost cafeteria service and a free gym (you have to burn off the extra calories from lunch dessert!).SALARY: Curious? It will be specified during the interview, as it is adjusted according to the number of internships you have completed.Company OverviewAboutiA Financial Group is the strength of a company with a human side, with its over 8,000 employees. Together, we have earned the trust of our more than four million clients and 25,000 advisors who have chosen us for their insurance, savings, and wealth management.With over $200 billion in assets and half a billion invested in technological innovation, we’re a key player in the financial services industry in Canada and the United States. The secret to our success? Investing in you, one person at a time. Because, for over 125 years, we have believed that it’s by supporting our employees and surrounding ourselves with the most reputable leaders in the industry, we will continue to innovate.At iA, we’re invested in you.Our commitment to Diversity and InclusionAt iA Financial Group, we support and celebrate diversity. We strive to provide a workplace that is recognized as inclusive for all, regardless of ethnic origin, nationality, language, religious beliefs, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, family situation, or physical or mental disability.Please note that if you need help or assistance to make the recruitment process more accessible for you, please contact us here. Someone from our team will be happy to assist you.

The People & Culture team is looking for a Data Analyst to build foundational tools, systems, and processes to improve our People analytics. You’ll partner with members of the People team on building out dashboards and reports, and ad hoc trend analysis, translating data into narratives and insights that shape our business decisions on everything from workforce planning to organizational performance. Every member of our team shares a common vision: to create the future we want to live in. We need the right people to help us realize that vision.What you’ll accomplish:Leverage your technical expertise and creative problem solving to build, enhance, and automate analytics capabilities for the People team and various stakeholders, creating user-friendly dashboards and visualizations using SQL and Tableau.Report on key metrics for the organization while informing, influencing, supporting, and executing business decisions in collaboration with other members of the People team.Lead in the ongoing development of the business intelligence and data solution ecosystem within the People organization, developing and championing best practices, improving existing data-collection methodologies, and empowering operational and exploratory analysis.Effectively manage multiple concurrent projects that require input and communication from diverse cross-functional stakeholders while balancing impact on business needs.A little about you:Experience with SQL, R, Python, or a similar scripting language (or similar language aimed at querying relational databases).Proficient in managing, manipulating, and validating large data sets from multiple systems, tools, and reports using statistical software or other methods.Able to handle sensitive data, and exercise judgment and discretion.Familiar with organizational People data (e.g. headcount, turnover, recruiting metrics, and other people analytics).Comfortable with an agile project management approach that emphasizes communication, coordination, flexible reassessment of plans, and iterative phases of work.Experience interacting with non-technical stakeholders and their reactive needs to ambiguous and changing priorities, even when all the information is not readily available.More about Dapper Labs:Dapper Labs, the company behind CryptoKitties, NBA Top Shot, NFL ALL DAY, UFC Strike and the Flow blockchain, uses blockchain technology to bring NFTs and new forms of digital engagement to fans around the world About YouWithin the retail industry, the supply chain operation is one of the most complex environments. In this role, you will be responsible for the analytical insight that drives the business as well as the automation that makes us faster. You are expected to deliver insights through a data driven approach, you create dashboards and reports that track and inform on company and carrier performance, and you implement the automation of error prone and low value tasks to allow your colleagues to focus on higher value decisions.Ultimately your work allows MEC to provide the right product, at the right time, at the right location.You’re inquisitive and you believe in empowering your colleagues throughout MEC to find new insights and solve interesting supply chain challenges.You love data and analytics, but you recognize that communicating these insights effectively to your colleagues within MEC, as well as external carrier partners, is as important as the quality of the analysis.You understand that tools and solutions must be designed to be intuitive and easy for our partners, staff and members to understand.You have a strong sense of the potential for software automation to simplify manual processes, reduce error rates, and free up time for more high value tasks.You have a deep understanding of the software systems that supports supply chain, logistics, buying, and BI and can provide expertise and thought leadership on how to support our colleagues that use these systems.About MECMEC is more than a store, and we’re more than a place to buy hats and backpacks. We’re physical and digital hubs for the outdoor community. People connect here, through our stores, online channels, over the phone, or through one of our leading events, clinics or services.MEC is an equal opportunity employer. We’re proud to work with our people to create a diverse workplace, which accommodates individuals of all abilities, backgrounds and identities. We welcome and encourage applications from people with disabilities. Tell us what you need during the hiring process, and we’ll do our best to accommodate you.The WHATSupport decision making in key processes across the Supply Chain group, such as demand forecasting, inventory management, and replenishment.Implement continuous improvement initiatives such as the automation of low-level, repetitive and error prone work though software tools and data analytics.Create dashboards and analyses that help track company, team, and individual performance, foster accountability, and capitalize on market opportunities.Work collaboratively with various stakeholders as a trusted partner and thought leader throughout MEC on the topic of supply chain, advanced analytics, and industry best practices.Act as a subject matter expert on the software systems associated with supply chain.What Great Looks LikeContinuous process improvementNew tools and processes created that save time, improve accuracy, increase consistency, and support more data driven decision making.Supporting key stakeholders and initiatives throughout Supply Chain group.Close collaboration and clear communication with our colleagues throughout MEC in understanding their problems, recommending solutions, and ensuring effective handoff and adoption of our tools and dashboards.Expertise on associated software systems.Lead and support our partners as subject matter experts around best practices, upgrades, and trouble shooting for our supply chain and software systems.ExperienceRequired5 year(s): Five years of experience in the logistics industry, or related industry.EducationPreferredBachelors or better in Logistics /Supply Chain Management or related fieldSkillsPreferredTeam work - Evaluation Analyst - RES005902Employment Type: Permanent Full-timeLocation(s): SK-Rgna-ReginaMinistry: 005 EducationSalary Range: $41.174-$51.598 HourlyGrade: SGEU.12.The Ministry of Education is committed to the success and well-being of all Saskatchewan learners and the enhancement of literacy for all Saskatchewan people. The Early Years Branch provides leadership to the early years’ sector.We are currently seeking a strategic, analytic, well-organized and collaborative candidate for the position of Evaluation Analyst. Reporting to the Director, Sector Planning and Evaluation, you will be part of a unit that is responsible for developing and implementing data strategies, so the branch is well-positioned to make evidence-based decisions and recommendations for the Early Years sector.This position will also be responsible for the identification, design and implementation of program and policy evaluations. Our candidate of choice will have experience in designing program and policy evaluation research strategies (including surveys, focus groups, interviews, literature reviews) and apply appropriate statistical and analytical techniques to determine program and policy effectiveness.An effective communicator and researcher, you will be able to understand complex challenges and provide sound data-driven advice for policy and program decision makers. Finally, your interpersonal skills will allow you to consult and work effectively with internal and external stakeholders to develop positive working relationships.You will bring knowledge of:qualitative and quantitative research methodologies;data assessment and analysis;program, policy and/or project evaluation techniques;applicable computer hardware, software, applications and databases;public policy development, analysis and review; andexperience working with external and internal stakeholders;You will have the ability to:Understand and integrate existing early years data, develop models and methodologies for data analysis, and use existing data to support planning, accountability, and decision-making.Identify gaps in current information, and design effective methods to collect it.Provide analytical support for a range of initiatives to advance the Ministry's strategic, business and accountability processes.Analyze and develop business cases to understand the value for money and priorities in the Early Years sector, as well as support evaluations for new and existing initiatives.Demonstrate sound judgment and discretion in handling confidential and sensitive information.Have experience developing working relationships with internal and external stakeholders to work towards a shared goal.Assess the performance and effectiveness of existing programs, research best practice, and propose options and recommendations for future direction.Prepare and clearly communicate both verbally and in writing analytical reports, program evaluations, briefing materials, correspondence, and other information to a variety of audiences.Typically, the experience and knowledge required for this position includes a master’s degree in Administration, Economics, Finance, or Human Services area as well as relevant experience. An equivalent combination of education and experience will be considered.Bilingualism is considered an asset working within the Ministry of Education. We are committed to workplace diversity.This position is designated for qualified equity group members who self-declare in this online application, as identified in "diversity groups" belowDiversity Groups: Aboriginal persons, Persons with disabilitiesHours of Work: A - SGEU Office 36 - one day off every two weeksNumber of Openings: 1Closing Date: Apr 2, 2022, 12:59:00 AM

Description:*We are a solutions-driven, customer-focused provider of material handling, storage, and automated systems solutions and we take pride in knowing that your actions boost our customers’ productivity. We are looking for customer-focused, self-starting individuals to join our team and make a difference. If that sounds like you, join the Johnston Equipment team today!Position Summary: The Market Data Analyst provides key business intelligence to both internal sales team and external customers. You will build a strong rapport across the customers organization with a focus on sales operations. You will establish relationships of trust and confidence and ensure that by leveraging data, our team and software will deliver the goals the customers seek. You have the internal energy and skills to breakdown complex data and deliver solutions and recommend actions for the key stakeholders at our Enterprise Class clients. You have the ability to create various reports to assist customers with interpreting the data available from our software. You have substantial experience in processing and graphing data.How You’ll Make an ImpactPrepares reports for National Accounts re: fleet utilization and maintenance costs for presentation to the customer by our National Account Analysts and the Account ManagerAnalyzes the maintenance and repair of customer equipment and identifies trends and problematic “hot spots” as requiredAudits service history, work order detail and invoices to ensure that each accounts’ specific procedures and policies are being adhered to i.e. Purchase order process / Accurate invoicing and provides necessary reports to appropriate departments and personnelPrepares reports on contract revenues, expenses, profit/lossMonitors and reports equipment delivery schedules for National Accounts; ; monthlyWorks closely with customer support group and sales team to facilitate achievement of Corporate, Departmental, and Customer goalsParticipates in regular scheduled Internal and Customer communication meetingsRecommends and develops value added reports and alternatives for customersParticipates in RFQ’s/RFP’s developmentCoordinates Fleet SurveysWorks with Customer Support Service Representative and prepares reports to forecast future fleet changes/movements/replacement strategies.Prepares customer maintenance agreements (CFPM and SM) and facilitates between appropriate departments and personnelFollows up on customer requests regarding equipment transfers i.e. CFPM/Lease and customer database changes) and facilitates between appropriate departments to maintain an accurate databaseMaintains a repository of Customer Contractor Agreements and Parts Consignment AgreementsContributes to Contract renewal process with Customer Support Service Representative, Business Account Manager and internal departmentsTracks expiring contracts (CFPM/Premier/Pre-paid) and ensures customer follow up takes placeDevelops and maintains GNJ National Account ROE (Rules of Engagement form) and Process and Procedural manualWhat You’ll Bring to the TableHave 3+ years of professional experience as a Data Analyst with large scale data and transform project is a must.Good hands-on experience with MS Excel skillsHands-on with Data Visualization Tools such as (Tableau, PowerBI)Experience in Data Storytelling and visualizations to be able to effectively communicate Proficient in Microsoft Office applications (Excel, Word, Visio, Pivot tables, etc..). Programming skills would be an asset, but not required.Works well in a team environmentAttention to detailMicrosoft Office experienced especially Word, Excel – graphs and pivot tables and PowerPointAnalytical skillsStrong Time Management and organizational skills (Working from home)Willingness to contact Customers when applicableComfortable talking to and meeting with customersWhy You’ll love it hereWe offer a competitive salary, incentive program, and an excellent benefits packageWe trust and support you - take ownership of your work and push your ideas from inception to executionWe want to see you grow - we support your career progression and provide learning and development opportunitiesWhile we appreciate all applications we receive, we advise that only candidates under consideration will be contacted.G.N. Johnston Equipment is committed to building a diverse and inclusive workplace. Qualified designated group members are encouraged to apply as any reasonable accommodation of qualifications will be considered as per our Accommodation Policy, available upon request.About Johnston Equipment: Johnston Equipment provides material handling equipment to move product in, out and throughout warehouses; service solutions and tools to better manage warehouse productivity; racking, storage and automated system solutions to optimize the storage and movement of goods; and programs to protect material handling assets and the people who utilize them. We are continually striving to create better and more advanced solutions as well as provide the highest quality service.We are growing and need talented professionals to drive our vision to create an effortless experience for our customers by delivering our products and services in an efficient and safe manner. Join us…. Make a difference!Job Types: Full-time, PermanentSchedule:Day shift

About UsG Adventures is the world’s largest small-group adventure travel company and we’ve been making epic travel memories happen on all seven continents for over 30 years.Our mission is simple: to change lives through travel. And not just our travelers’ either. Since day one, our tours have been built to establish meaningful relationships with local communities, directly benefiting the people and places we visit at every step of our tours.With the demand for travel coming back strong, we are set up and excited for this next chapter in our company’s story — and we’d love for you to be a part of it.Our DNA revolves around building, nurturing, and developing a diverse culture of people and a true sense of belonging, where everyone is encouraged to bring their authentic self to work each and every day. You’ll have the opportunity to grow your career, and yourself, alongside a passionate, talented, and welcoming community that works hard to spread goodness around the world.If all that sounds like your kind of thing, well, we can’t wait for you to join us.There are 2 positions open in this posting - One permanent role and One 14 month Contract role.About the Role:Reporting to the Manager, Global Revenue Management, the Revenue and Inventory Analyst is responsible for providing support to the strategic and profitable management of G Adventures product. As part of a greater team, this position will play a role in facilitating and supporting profitable growth, while minimizing excessive risk, through effective revenue and inventory management and data analysis.This role will actively communicate with a variety of company stakeholders and provide recommendations to achieve optimal outcomes for our travellers and the organization. Further, this role will have a particular focus on ideating and supporting cross-functional predictive analytics projects. This role will utilize tools and resources including the full set of Company systems reports, discounting, special promotions, marketing initiatives, local sales, and inventory load management as tactics to achieve targets.What You'll be DoingPlan, build and monitor inventory levels for assigned regions and productsSet pricing strategy for each assigned product through analysis of cost information from the contracting team and in line competitive research and commercial needsReview, analyze and report on profitabilityCollaborate with regional product and operations teams to understand challenges or opportunities that relate to profitability (e.g. cost changes on trip profitability)Work closely with various sales and marketing stakeholders to identify ways to drive sales growthDevelop relationships across departments to ensure full support of risk product (e.g. boats, overland vehicles) and coordinate efforts towards our company product prioritiesImplement inventory management strategies to achieve targets set by company through discounting, pricing strategy and the likeGain an in depth understanding of Key Performance Indicators and taking appropriate action to achieve company and departmental targetsUse a wide variety of available reports and reporting tools to employ data analysis techniques to derive meaningful insights, patterns and trends with the dual goals of profitability maximization and high customer satisfaction scoresRepresent and drive the interests of the revenue management department through effective and clear communication with stakeholdersDevelop and deliver audience-appropriate presentations of revenue management data intelligenceDevelop and implement new procedures and reporting to maximize profitability and efficiencyAssist in the provision of regular reports and stats for the Senior Leadership team as requiredTeamworkTo contribute to G Adventures performance by displaying a positive, enthusiastic attitude and showing support and involvement in G Adventures initiatives and activitiesAttend team & cross functional meetingsAttendance at work functions, presentations, G Adventures events (virtual options available)Support other team members when necessaryPromote a positive team environment and work towards motivating other membersRequired Skills and ExperienceBachelor’s degree in Business, Engineering, Math, Economics or similar or equivalent training and experienceMinimum of 2 years’ experience in an analyst role or similarAt least 1-2 years’ experience with creating and analyzing forecasting and trending dataAt least 1 year experience working with stakeholders or customers, preferably from a variety of cultural or language backgroundsIntermediate knowledge of Excel or Google SheetsExperience with CRM or Business Intelligence software (eg. Salesforce, Tableau, Looker)Exceptional verbal and written communication skills. Specifically, the ability to communicate large, complex data sets and complex processes in a meaningful way to stakeholders with varied knowledge of the subject matterExperience with project management, particularly across cross-functional teamsExtremely organized with the ability to prioritize and manage multiple competing demandsSuperior attention to detail and a love of problem solvingSolid understanding of travel industry, product, processes, and our competitors is an assetUnderstanding of, and identification with, G Adventures’ Core ValuesWhat do we offer you?Competitive salary commensurate with the roleCompetitive benefits packageBirthday day offVacation time for you to rechargeEnhanced Parental LeaveLearning and growth opportunitiesG Adventures is an equal opportunity employer committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive work environment. We consider all qualified applicants and will meet the needs of those requiring reasonable accommodations. If you require accommodation, please reach out to the Global Talent team at talent@gadventures.com.

Company DescriptionGSoft is the independent software company behind a family of products focussing on distributed work and using the digital revolution to change the employee experience. Our goal is to make work simpler, kinder and faster. One software at a time.Specifically, we help companies get the most out of Microsoft with ShareGate. We help managers grow their teams with Officevibe. And we ensure every onboarding is a success with Softstart.Every day, we find better ways to work.Job Description_So, what will your new role actually look like?_In addition to product usage data, our various internal teams (Marketing, Sales, Customer Experience, etc.) also generate a significant amount of relevant data for decision making. GSoft wants to make the most of this large amount of data to support our various business decisions and product development!You will support the team in increasing the maturity of the organization in relation to Data, in addition to:Build comprehensive analytical solutions to provide tools for decision-making.Perform advanced analysis to guide the company in its strategic choices.Support the various GSoft teams in :Best practices in terms of data collection and usage;Defining and tracking team metrics and goals;Development of the GSoft data culture.Develop statistical and predictive models that allow us to improve the company's processes.Create centralized dashboards and support teams in creating their own data visualizations in different tools.Be proactive in maintaining and improving data quality.What does your future team look like?You will join GSoft's Data & Analytics team, a team composed of diverse data science expertise, including data engineers and data scientists. You will therefore be called upon to work in collaboration with them to evolve our data ecosystem and increase the organization's data maturity.In addition, you will be required to collaborate with business teams to fully understand their contexts, goals and use cases.What are the next challenges awaiting your team?Support the Culture & Organization team in leveraging their data (People Analytics).Train the teams in the use of data visualization features of different tools.Set up the foundation to track the customer journey through our different products.Develop lead scoring models to support marketing and sales teams.Continuous improvement of our data warehouses and visualization tools to increase data quality (creation of a single source of truth).QualificationsHave a few years of experience in data analysis and/or analytical model design.Experience in programming (SQL, Python, R, DAX, etc.).Experience in data visualization and presentation (PowerBI, Tableau, Looker, etc.).Have knowledge of :Statistics and mathematics;Modeling methods (prediction, classification, etc.);Data preparation (extraction, cleaning, etc.);Data models, architectures, warehouses and data environment (basic knowledge).Advanced data analysis techniques.Ability to understand business issues, transform them into technology requirements and clearly communicate analysis results.Ability to collaborate with different teams and support them in their data development.Be able to adapt quickly to a change in context.Additional InformationAt GSoft, we build together, we trust each other, and we support each other in success or failure. You will be able to express yourself, evolve and develop your creativity in an environment that will adapt to your daily life and your needs.We strive to create a healthy and inclusive work environment. This is everyone’s business.Our Candidate Experience Flow at GSoft: Phone Screen - Virtual Interview using Microsoft Teams - Work Sample - Job OfferWe are looking forward to getting to know you!#LI-RemoteLocation: 1751 Rue Richardson, Montréal, QCJob Type: Full-time

Intermediate level proficiency with Microsoft Word sufficient to create text and tables for memos and reports is required. Job Type: PermanentPrimary Location: Multiple Locations, Ontario, CanadaAll Available Locations: Toronto; Burlington; Calgary; Kitchener; London; Ottawa; Vancouver; Vaughan; WindsorOur PurposeAt Deloitte, we are driven to inspire and help our people, organization, communities, and country to thrive. As a Data Analyst, you will be working on the creation of financial crime analytics insights during our client engagements leveraging the following:Analytics – SQLData preparation and modeling – SSIS, T-SQL, AlteryxVisualization – Tableau OR Power BIData management system – SQL Server OR Hadoop HiveYou also have:Completed a bachelor’s degree or master’s degree preferably in a quantitative discipline such as: Mathematics, Statistics, Engineering, Computer Science, Quantitative Finance1-5 years of professional work experience in consulting or analytics, preferably related to financial crime1-5 years of experience querying and analyzing large data sets in SQLProven experience with T-SQL and Alteryx for data transformation and solutioningExperience designing dashboards in Tableau or PowerBI to deliver analytical insightsProven experience creating PowerPoint decks and giving presentations to executives and stakeholdersProject management experience including budgeting, activity tracking and stakeholder communicationOur shared valuesWhile our Purpose guides us and helps explain why we exist, our shared values describe the behaviour we expect from each other at the firm.They provide common ground to unite us across cultures and geographies. They help us to earn the trust and respect of our stakeholders. We all commit to living by these shared values, to stay true to the principles they represent, and to honour the legacy from which they came. They are what sets us apart and makes us Deloitte.Every day, we live our Purpose through the following five shared values:Lead the way: Deloitte is not only leading the profession, but reinventing it for the future. We’re also committed to creating opportunity and leading the way to a more sustainable world.Serve with integrity: Deloitte has earned the trust of employees, clients, regulators, and the public for 175 years. Upholding that trust is our single most important responsibility.Take care of each other: We look out for one another and prioritize respect, fairness, development, and well-being.Foster inclusion: We are at our best when we foster an inclusive culture and embrace diversity in all forms. We know this attracts top talent, enables innovation, and helps us deliver well-rounded client solutions.Collaborate for measurable impact: We approach our work with a collaborative mind¬set, teaming across businesses, geographies, and skill sets to deliver tangible, measurable, attributable impact.The next step is yoursSound like The One Firm. For You? Apply Now!At Deloitte, we are all about doing business inclusively – that starts with having diverse colleagues of all abilities. We’d love to hear from you!By applying to this job you will be assessed against the Deloitte Global Talent Standards. As a Sr. Risk Analyst in Trust & Safety, you’ll play a major role at Dapper driving data-driven decisions to help optimize user security, minimize financial losses, and develop performance transparency.The ideal candidate will have a strong drive for analytic strategy, be decisive, and has experience developing and implementing risk mitigation solutions.What we’ll accomplish together:Optimize the end-to-end fraud risk strategy for Dapper platformDevelop strong relationships with key leads across product, engineering, data science and business teams to effectively manage fraud risk programsImprove existing policies, reporting, and workflowsObtain insights from transaction & product data to come up with new strategies to mitigate/stop high-risk activitiesBuild a deep understanding of the Risk data, reporting, and key metricsDevelop governance, escalation, accountability, and remediation strategies and frameworksA little about you:Undergraduate degree, technical certificate, or relevant work experienceExcellent data analysis skills (SQL, Python) and dashboarding experience (Tableau, PowerBI)An analytical approach to decision-making. You are analytical, objective and skilled at using metrics to drive decisionsAbility to independently structure and deliver analysis and solutions for issues not previously identifiedAbility to stay calm in critical situations, willing to prioritize and resolve complex issuesSupport workflow valuation and prioritization to optimize fraud review efficiencyAn excellent problem solver, ability to quickly get to the root and common patterns of problemsThe Trust & Safety team prioritizes user safety and a platform free of collusion and bad actors.You'll be a key leader of the team responsible for ensuring that reporting and analysis are efficient, effective, and accurate. Your focus, and that of the overall team, will be promoting the best possible user experience with effective safeguards to mitigate harmful activity.As Dapper continues to expand, you will help manage the risk mitigation across many countries and payment methods.More about Dapper Labs:Dapper Labs, the company behind CryptoKitties, NBA Top Shot, NFL ALL DAY, UFC Strike and the Flow blockchain, uses blockchain technology to bring NFTs and new forms of digital engagement to fans around the world paving the way to a more open and inclusive digital world starting with games and entertainment.Since it was founded in 2018, Dapper Labs has given consumer enthusiasts a real stake in the game by bringing them closer to the brands they love, building engaged and exciting communities for them to contribute to, and producing new pathways for them to become creators themselves. We’re ready to empower even more to bring mainstream-ready user experiences and scale to web3 applications.Visit our website to learn even more about Dapper Labs, including information about benefits and perks.#LIremote

Coordinate the collection and analysis of the sustainability data from and for the different regional investment teamsEvaluate new and alternative data sources and new data integration techniquesPerform user acceptance tests for production deploymentDevelop and maintain a database (library) of ESG metrics definitions and templatesSupport in identifying root causes of ESG integration gaps and solutions to close these gaps.Develop and maintain business relationships with stakeholders, including data providers, NGOs, ratings agencies, internal management, and operating company executives.What you will bringKnowledge & ExpertiseBachelor's or Master's degree in one of the following: commerce, finance, accounting, business analytics, computer science, statistics and mathematics or a related field;3-5 years' experience in finance, consulting, investor relations, corporate reporting, investment banking, or other related field;Knowledge or experience in one or more of the following fields is an asset: business, management, risk management, sustainable development, sustainable finance, consulting, finance, capital markets, corporate reporting, investor relations, governance, climate change;AttributesHighly knowledgeable in data management concepts and best practices and experienced in automating processesStrong data analytics and visualization skills, comfortable working with large datasets, using Business Intelligence and/or reporting tools (query structured databases). As members of the Power Financial Corporation group of companies, we’re one of Canada’s leading insurers with interests in life insurance, health insurance, investment and retirement savings. We offer a broad portfolio of financial and benefit plan solutions for individuals, families, businesses and organizations.We are committed to providing an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected and supported. Data Analyst, Data ManagementConnor, Clark & Lunn Financial GroupVancouver, BCThe Data Management Team (DMT) resides within the middle office and is responsible for managing data centric processes and data quality that supports the investment management business. The team ensures that daily and historical data is accurate, data transport processes are successful, and complies with overall data governance. The DMT is a key thought-leader in driving data management maturity at Connor, Clark & Lunn Financial Group (CCLFG). CCLFG manages a wide range of global assets and heavily relies on the output of the DMT for a variety of functions from the front office to the back. This is a fantastic opportunity to be part of a dynamic strategic team whose scope and importance continues to grow.We place a high value on maintaining an entrepreneurial spirit and creating a culture where each of us have opportunities to succeed. We are a solution orientated and collaborative team seeking likeminded individuals who thrive in a challenging and dynamic environment. This is a Vancouver based role, which offers a flexibility between working from home and the office.What You’ll Be DoingThis role operates in a unique position, working closely with business operations and systems technology. Your work will consist of creating and managing investment data for a variety of global security types, ensuring high quality and overseeing data processes. In addition to operational responsibilities, there are project and investigative aspects including continuous process improvement and ad-hoc problem solving in both an independent and collaborative setting. You are empowered to thrive as a process owner with both the creativity and responsibility that comes with delegation. You will have the opportunity to work directly with multiple partners including global investment managers, trade operations, portfolio compliance, and information technology.As a Data Analyst, you will bring your attention-to-detail to oversee data-processes and ensure data-quality across multiple systems. You will be able to isolate and resolve data-issues proactively, or when alerted by other business partners, in a well-organized and responsive fashion. You can expect to develop into a process-owner and subject-matter-expert that provides high-value contributions to the investment process. In this capacity you will be working with a variety of stakeholders including traders, portfolio managers, developers, and numerous middle and back-office teams. You are comfortable working with databases and business applications to investigate and resolve issues as well as write business requirements and test software improvements. You will apply a continuous process improvement mindset to keep evolving systems and processes in line with growing data needs.Key responsibilities include:Maintain and validate fixed-income and equity data across multiple systems and databases with a high level of accuracy and attention to detailPrioritize and manage scheduled processes, ad-hoc requests, and projects in collaboration with multiple business partners to support analytic, investing, and portfolio management functionsAnalyze exception reports and follow-up to ensure timely resolutionIdentify, develop and implement scalable improvements to support ever-changing requirementsProactively seek out and implement process improvements to increase efficiency, mitigate risk, and increase the level of service provided to stakeholdersDefine and implement continuous data quality improvements (policy, procedures, processes, audits)Support the Manager on a variety of ad hoc tasks and projects.About YouIndustry Knowledge – a minimum of 2 years of experience in the investment management industry with exposure to securities data, data process management, Bloomberg, and related tools is an asset.Education – You have a degree in Finance, Mathematics, Data Science, Computer Science, or a related field. Completion of or enrollment in a relevant designation, such as the CFA or FRM, is an asset.Database Knowledge – You can understand, query, and analyze results from complex datasets.Problem Solver – You possess an analytical mindset and able to break down complex processes into components in able to logically deduce the root cause of issues.Collaborative – You have a collaborative spirit that helps you to work well with others and you communicate effectively.Self-Motivated – You have a passion for advancing the quality, scale, and efficiency of data processes and are able to take ownership of multiple processes with keen attention to detail.Continuous Process Improvement Mindset – You constantly take a critical eye to processes with the goal of finding improvement opportunities and bring an ability to manage multiple projects.About Connor, Clark & Lunn Financial GroupConnor, Clark & Lunn Financial Group Ltd. (“CCLFG”) provides a broad range of traditional and alternative investment products and services to individuals, advisors and institutional investors. Our business comprises of eleven institutional investment affiliates that are responsible for investment decision making and client service, as well as distribution affiliates including Connor Clark & Lunn Private Capital, which provides multi-asset class investment solutions and Connor, Clark & Lunn Funds which distributes single-strategy investments to individual investors. CCLFG partners with each of its affiliates by contributing world class operations, product development expertise, broad distribution, and business management. We have grown from $29 billion in assets and 200 people in 2008 to approximately $105 billion in assets and over 700 employees today. This has been accompanied by a high level of change in technology, types of assets managed, trading activity and geographic growth. As we look forward, we can see both opportunities and challenges for further growth that only reinforce our commitment to attracting, retaining and motivating the most talented people.This is best achieved by:A High-Quality Environment: To work with people who we hold in high regard; to enjoy the time that we spend at work; to focus on productive activities without the distraction of politics and bureaucracy; to treat each other with respect.An Opportunity to Succeed: To do work that has value and which presents the opportunity for professional growth and development.Recognition and Reward: To recognize each person’s contribution and to align compensation with contribution.CC&L is committed to creating a diverse and inclusive environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to gender, ethnicity, religion, sexual orientation or expression, disability, or age.To apply for this position, please submit your resume and cover letter as one PDF.We thank all applicants in advance for their interest, but only those candidates shortlisted for interviews will be contacted. No telephone calls or recruitment agencies will be accepted.
